4204807632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-machine-learning-engineer-at-motork-4204807632?position=4&pageNum=5&refId=OfBi2onRErmCkQNrQ8ZSmg%3D%3D&trackingId=QbaOnBcizFMUsupbl1GEQg%3D%3D,Senior Machine Learning Engineer,MotorK,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","MotorK is the leading sales and marketing technology company in Europe, specialized in the automotive sector. At MotorK our mission is to empower manufacturers and dealerships to sell more with innovative, cloud-based products and services to offer the best digital customer experience.

We are on a fast and ambitious trajectory and serving 90% of the automotive manufacturers. To continue our growth, we are hiring new talents. If you want to spark the future of the automotive world, join us.

As a Machine Learning Engineer at MotorK, you will be pivotal in driving innovation and improving customer experience. You will develop and deploy machine learning models to power automotive maintenance prediction, product classification, and marketing asset generation. Your work will directly impact the company's revenue, customer satisfaction, and overall business success.
Design, develop, and train machine learning models, including recommendation systems, predictive analytics, and classification algorithms.
Collaborate with data engineers to extract, clean, and transform large datasets from various sources.
Deploy models into production environments, ensuring scalability and reliability.
Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of machine learning models on key metrics.
Work closely with product managers and software engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior ML engineers on best practices and business-oriented problem-solving.
5+ years experience as a machine learning engineer or data scientist in a digital product environment
Strong foundation in machine learning, including deep learning and statistical modelling.
Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or XGBoost).
Experience with cloud platforms and MLOps, preferably AWS.
Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Passion for data-driven innovation and a desire to make a significant impact.
Opportunity to develop and move within the company

MotorK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any kind. Our company is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at MotorK are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, religion or belief, age, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

MotorK is the leading sales and marketing technology company in Europe, specialized in the automotive sector. At MotorK our mission is to empower manufacturers and dealerships to sell more with innovative, cloud-based products and services to offer the best digital customer experience.

We are on a fast and ambitious trajectory and serving 90% of the automotive manufacturers. To continue our growth, we are hiring new talents. If you want to spark the future of the automotive world, join us.



About the Role

As a Machine Learning Engineer at MotorK, you will be pivotal in driving innovation and improving customer experience. You will develop and deploy machine learning models to power automotive maintenance prediction, product classification, and marketing asset generation. Your work will directly impact the company's revenue, customer satisfaction, and overall business success.


What You'll Do

  • Design, develop, and train machine learning models, including recommendation systems, predictive analytics, and classification algorithms.
  • Collaborate with data engineers to extract, clean, and transform large datasets from various sources.
  • Deploy models into production environments, ensuring scalability and reliability.
  • Conduct A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of machine learning models on key metrics.
  • Work closely with product managers and software engineers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior ML engineers on best practices and business-oriented problem-solving.


Requirements

  • 5+ years experience as a machine learning engineer or data scientist in a digital product environment
  • Strong foundation in machine learning, including deep learning and statistical modelling.
  • Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or XGBoost).
  • Experience with cloud platforms and MLOps, preferably AWS.
  • Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Passion for data-driven innovation and a desire to make a significant impact.


Benefits

Working pattern and location

  • 40 hours per week, permanent contract
column2:
• Monday - Friday
  • Hybrid role


    • Benefits

    • Meal Vouchers (€7 per working day)
    • 26 days holidays + national bank holidays
column3:

  • Opportunity to develop and move within the company
  • National and international mobility options

4199397988,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ai-data-scientist-at-lutech-4199397988?position=5&pageNum=5&refId=OfBi2onRErmCkQNrQ8ZSmg%3D%3D&trackingId=VSn6OwA4XKcytSN7OjAqTA%3D%3D,AI Data Scientist,Lutech,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","The Digital Evolution Company Of Today And Tomorrow

Progettiamo soluzioni end-to-end per la Digital Evolution gestendone ogni area, grazie alle nostre sei anime tecnologiche: LutechConsulting, LutechSolutions, LutechDigital, LutechCybersecurity, LutechServices e LutechCloud.
Siamo motivati da una passione inesauribile per l’innovazione e una forte determinazione a superare limiti e ostacoli perché il fulcro di ogni nostro successo sono le nostre persone.

In Lutech potrai operare all’interno di una vera community tecnologica, che contribuirai a far crescere e a migliorare con le tue competenze. Troverai un ambiente inclusivo e informale in cui nessuno è un numero e tutti siamo un valore. Diamo importanza alla diversità riconoscendo che la forza di un team risiede nelle esperienze, prospettive e background unici che ogni persona porta con sé.
Come Data scientist, nella nostra practice Data analytics, sarai coinvolto in attività di sviluppo di modelli di machine learning in ambito AI/GenAI.
Sviluppare modelli di machine learning e algoritmi avanzati per risolvere problemi complessi.
Analizzare dataset per estrarre insight significativi e supportare decisioni aziendali strategiche.
Collaborare strettamente con i clienti per comprendere le loro esigenze e tradurle in soluzioni tecniche efficaci.
Gestire progetti end-to-end, dalla definizione dei requisiti alla consegna delle soluzioni.
Partecipare a progetti che avranno come obiettivo finale l'implementazione di una piattaforma, basata su GenAI, che supporti il cliente nella consultazione di documenti tecnici di progetto.
IS THIS THE ROLE FOR YOU?
Esperienza di almeno 2 anni in ruolo analogo
Conoscenza approfondita di una o più piattaforme cloud, con preferenza per GCP Vertex AI.
Ottima padronanza del linguaggio di programmazione Python. Ottima padronanza di SQL.
Preferibile conoscenza di strumenti di data visualization e reporting come PowerBI.
Preferibile conoscenza di strumenti di CI/CD e Git
TAKE YOUR STEP INTO THE DIGITAL EVOLUTION.
Dai alla tua carriera l’accelerata che sta aspettando: fai l’application ed entra in una realtà unica nel suo genere.
La tua sede di lavoro potrà essere Milano o Bergamo e potrai operare in modalità ibrida.

Lutech attua una politica di pari opportunità e accoglie le candidature senza operare alcuna discriminazione in base a razza, religione o convinzioni personali, origine etnica o nazionale, disabilità, età, cittadinanza, stato civile, inclusa convivenza di fatto e unione civile, orientamento sessuale, identità di genere, o qualsiasi altra condizione applicabile tutelata dalla legge.

The Digital Evolution Company Of Today And Tomorrow

Progettiamo soluzioni end-to-end per la Digital Evolution gestendone ogni area, grazie alle nostre sei anime tecnologiche: LutechConsulting, LutechSolutions, LutechDigital, LutechCybersecurity, LutechServices e LutechCloud.

Siamo motivati da una passione inesauribile per l’innovazione e una forte determinazione a superare limiti e ostacoli perché il fulcro di ogni nostro successo sono le nostre persone.

In Lutech potrai operare all’interno di una vera community tecnologica, che contribuirai a far crescere e a migliorare con le tue competenze. Troverai un ambiente inclusivo e informale in cui nessuno è un numero e tutti siamo un valore. Diamo importanza alla diversità riconoscendo che la forza di un team risiede nelle esperienze, prospettive e background unici che ogni persona porta con sé.

Posizione

Come Data scientist, nella nostra practice Data analytics, sarai coinvolto in attività di sviluppo di modelli di machine learning in ambito AI/GenAI.

In Particolare, Ti Occuperai Di

  • Sviluppare modelli di machine learning e algoritmi avanzati per risolvere problemi complessi.
  • Analizzare dataset per estrarre insight significativi e supportare decisioni aziendali strategiche.
  • Collaborare strettamente con i clienti per comprendere le loro esigenze e tradurle in soluzioni tecniche efficaci.
  • Gestire progetti end-to-end, dalla definizione dei requisiti alla consegna delle soluzioni.
  • Partecipare a progetti che avranno come obiettivo finale l'implementazione di una piattaforma, basata su GenAI, che supporti il cliente nella consultazione di documenti tecnici di progetto.

Requisiti

IS THIS THE ROLE FOR YOU?

Cerchiamo Te Se Hai

  • Esperienza di almeno 2 anni in ruolo analogo
  • Conoscenza approfondita di una o più piattaforme cloud, con preferenza per GCP Vertex AI.
  • Ottima padronanza del linguaggio di programmazione Python. Ottima padronanza di SQL.
  • Preferibile conoscenza di strumenti di data visualization e reporting come PowerBI.
  • Preferibile conoscenza di strumenti di CI/CD e Git

Altre Informazioni

TAKE YOUR STEP INTO THE DIGITAL EVOLUTION.

Dai alla tua carriera l’accelerata che sta aspettando: fai l’application ed entra in una realtà unica nel suo genere.

La tua sede di lavoro potrà essere Milano o Bergamo e potrai operare in modalità ibrida.

Lutech attua una politica di pari opportunità e accoglie le candidature senza operare alcuna discriminazione in base a razza, religione o convinzioni personali, origine etnica o nazionale, disabilità, età, cittadinanza, stato civile, inclusa convivenza di fatto e unione civile, orientamento sessuale, identità di genere, o qualsiasi altra condizione applicabile tutelata dalla legge.

Chaberton Professionals, divisione di Chaberton Partners dedicata alla ricerca e selezione di profili di Middle Management, è attualmente alla ricerca di un/una Data Scientist per un nostro importante cliente, scaleup operante in ambito EdTech.


Descrizione della posizione


La risorsa si occuperà di:


  • sviluppare e implementare strategie di gestione dei dati per ottimizzare la raccolta, l’analisi e la gestione delle informazioni.
  • Guidare le iniziative data-driven, garantendo l’accuratezza e la qualità dei dati, collaborando con team interdisciplinari per massimizzare il loro impatto.
  • Condurre analisi esplorative dei dati per individuare schemi e tendenze che favoriscano la crescita aziendale e l’innovazione.
  • Fornire insight per sviluppare modelli predittivi e algoritmi avanzati.
  • Progettare e sviluppare modelli predittivi per personalizzare l’esperienza utente, migliorare il coinvolgimento e aumentare la fidelizzazione.


E ancora:


  • Utilizzerà tecniche di machine learning e modellazione statistica per analizzare il comportamento degli utenti e creare soluzioni su misura.
  • Collaborerà con team interdisciplinari per identificare e dare priorità alle iniziative data-driven.
  • Creerà visualizzazioni e report di dati efficaci per comunicare insight e risultati in modo chiaro e intuitivo, supportando le decisioni strategiche dell’azienda.


Requisiti


  • Laurea in Statistica ,Informatica, Matematica o in un campo correlato
  • Esperienza consolidata in modellazione statistica, machine learning e data mining
  • Conoscenza di Python per analisi dati e sviluppo di modelli
  • Esperienza con database SQL e NoSQL
  • Competenza nell’estrazione e analisi di dati di
  • Esperienza con strumenti di data visualization come Looker, Tableau, Power BI o D3.js
  • Ottime capacità di problem-solving e attenzione ai dettagli
  • Eccellenti doti di comunicazione e collaborazione
  • Esperienza nel settore EdTech (preferenziale)



Location: Milano, modalità ibrida (1gg di SW)

4150242919,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/graduate-program-2025-data-science-analytics-at-nexi-group-4150242919?position=9&pageNum=5&refId=OfBi2onRErmCkQNrQ8ZSmg%3D%3D&trackingId=%2Bgf7xKATgJHNH%2FVJE9nuYg%3D%3D,Graduate Program 2025 - Data Science & Analytics,Nexi Group,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Are you looking to kick off your career journey?
Do you like the idea of joining the European PayTech?
If so, you are at the right place!

Our graduate program offers you the chance to create your unique career path within our diverse international team, operating in more than 25 countries. Rotate among different departments, learn from experienced professionals, and make a difference by working on real business cases.
Our Graduate Program is more than a learning path - it's a journey where you will work on real business cases and have a direct impact on business results.
Permanent position in one of the business departments from the start of your employment.
Two rotations between different business departments during the 12-month program.
Project Management and Communication training path after the first six months.
Continuous learning and skill improvement through structured training sessions at our Digital PayTech University.
Opportunity to develop business ideas, implement them, and build your network of stakeholders within a group of highly skilled business leaders from all over Europe.
Exciting Opportunities in Data Science and Analytics

As part of our Data Science and Analytics team, you will contribute to data-driven decision-making in the Paytech industry. You'll work in positions such as Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and BI Data Engineer.

In this department, you'll analyse large datasets, transform data into insights, develop predictive models, and create data visualisations to support business strategies. This role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools and technologies, enhancing your analytical skills and significantly impacting our company's success.

As part of our selection process, the top candidates will be invited to participate in an exciting hackathon at our office location. This is a fantastic opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with peers, and potentially secure a spot on our team. Stay tuned for more details!
What makes you stand out as the ideal participant for this program?
If you see yourself in the description that follows, you should definitely take the first step and apply!
You have a master's degree in Engineering, STEM or Economics & Business, graduated within the last 12 months or will graduate in 2025.
You are a career starter with no more than one year of working experience.
You are fluent in English and in the local language of the country you are applying for (any additional language is beneficial).

You can easily imagine working in an international environment and actively collaborating with colleagues from all over Europe (if you have study or work-related international experience from abroad, that will be considered a beneficial qualification).
You are committed to your work, have an exciting university career with proven great results, enjoy learning new things, feel confident to own projects by yourself and like being part of a team.
For you, formal training is a starting point - you always look for more and want to make a difference in everything you work on.
Don't miss out on this amazing opportunity. Apply today and discover what's in it for you!
We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong. By applying to our Graduate Program, you're one step closer to joining us.
We're excited to learn more about you!

Are you looking to kick off your career journey?

Do you like the idea of joining the European PayTech?


If so, you are at the right place!


Our graduate program offers you the chance to create your unique career path within our diverse international team, operating in more than 25 countries. Rotate among different departments, learn from experienced professionals, and make a difference by working on real business cases.


About the program

Our Graduate Program is more than a learning path - it's a journey where you will work on real business cases and have a direct impact on business results.


What can you expect?

  • Permanent position in one of the business departments from the start of your employment.
  • Two rotations between different business departments during the 12-month program.
  • Project Management and Communication training path after the first six months.
  • Continuous learning and skill improvement through structured training sessions at our Digital PayTech University.
  • Opportunity to develop business ideas, implement them, and build your network of stakeholders within a group of highly skilled business leaders from all over Europe.


Exciting Opportunities in Data Science and Analytics

As part of our Data Science and Analytics team, you will contribute to data-driven decision-making in the Paytech industry. You'll work in positions such as Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and BI Data Engineer.


In this department, you'll analyse large datasets, transform data into insights, develop predictive models, and create data visualisations to support business strategies. This role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools and technologies, enhancing your analytical skills and significantly impacting our company's success.


As part of our selection process, the top candidates will be invited to participate in an exciting hackathon at our office location. This is a fantastic opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with peers, and potentially secure a spot on our team. Stay tuned for more details!


What makes you stand out as the ideal participant for this program?

If you see yourself in the description that follows, you should definitely take the first step and apply!

  • You have a master's degree in Engineering, STEM or Economics &
column2:
Business, graduated within the last 12 months or will graduate in 2025.
  • You are a career starter with no more than one year of working experience.
  • You are fluent in English and in the local language of the country you are applying for (any additional language is beneficial).
  • You can easily imagine working in an international environment and actively collaborating with colleagues from all over Europe (if you have study or work-related international experience from abroad, that will be considered a beneficial qualification).
  • You are committed to your work, have an exciting university career with proven great results, enjoy learning new things, feel confident to own projects by yourself and like being part of a team.
  • For you, formal training is a starting point - you always look for more and want to make a difference in everything you work on.


    • Apply Now!

    Don't miss out on this amazing opportunity. Apply today and discover what's in it for you!


    We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong. By applying to our Graduate Program, you're one step closer to joining us.


    We're excited to learn more about you!

4167061471,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/experienced-%E2%80%93-ai-data-at-deloitte-4167061471?position=10&pageNum=5&refId=OfBi2onRErmCkQNrQ8ZSmg%3D%3D&trackingId=zDWtsb3BpiN6Zru40d1QNg%3D%3D,Experienced – AI & Data,Deloitte,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Stiamo cercando una figura Senior da inserire nel team AI Insights & Engagements di Deloitte Consulting nelle sedi di Milano, Roma che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Il business AI Insight & Engagements si occupa di supportare i nostri clienti nella individuazione di soluzioni e modelli finalizzati al miglioramento della produttività, efficienza, qualità dei servizi offerti, anche con il supporto delle nuove tecnologie.

La Risorsa Sarà Integrata In Un Team Che Si Occupa Di Progetti Riguardanti L'Artificial Intelligence, In Particolare Machine Learning e Generative AI. L'attività Riguarderà La Gestione Attiva e Responsabile Di Progetti Complessi, Coordinando Parte Del Team e Supportando Il Manager Nella Relazione Con Il Cliente. Nello Specifico Si Occuperà Di
Integrare le proposte ai clienti con soluzioni basate su utilizzo di analytics e nuove tecnologie
Coordinare i colleghi junior e fungere da punto di riferimento per clienti nazionali e internazionali.
Esperienza di almeno 3 anni in progettualità relative a ML con l’utilizzo di Python
Capacità di disegnare soluzioni di Data Science
Conoscenza di almeno uno dei 3 principali cloud provider: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform
Competenze digitali e tecnologiche relative ai principali tools di Advanced Analytics

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.
Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

4201845462,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-warman-o-brien-4201845462?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=Y1LpzKSnyINfHCakvc6coA%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Warman O'Brien,"Brussels Region, Belgium","We are looking for a Medior Data Scientist to join our team and support the rollout of a cutting-edge data reduction system for a prominent pharma client. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a large-scale data strategy, helping to shape data structures, integrate data, and develop new analytical functionalities to enhance data visualization.

As part of the Data Strategy & Reduction Group, you will play a pivotal role in improving analytical capabilities, ensuring robust data transformation, and enabling seamless integration across systems. Your work will directly support the broader data strategy, delivering actionable insights and driving innovation in the pharmaceutical sector.
Develop and optimize data models to support data reduction and insights generation.
Manage and integrate efficient data pipelines.
Collaborate with business analysts to understand data requirements and provide effective technical solutions.
Implement advanced analytical models and statistical techniques to enhance data processing and visualization, specifically within Spotfire.
Design and deploy automated workflows for scalable, impactful insights.
Contribute to data quality initiatives, including anomaly detection, data cleansing, and validation.
Develop and refine best practices for data science applications in a pharmaceutical environment.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior team members (if applicable).
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Bioinformatics).
3+ years of experience in data science, preferably in the life sciences or pharmaceutical sector.
Strong expertise in data management, visualization, and analytics concepts.
Proficiency with Tibco software platform, especially for data visualization (Tibco Spotfire, Tableau, Power BI are a plus).
Solid programming skills in Python, R, or SQL.
Experience with large datasets, ETL processes, and optimizing data pipelines.
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data challenges into clear, actionable solutions.
Strong communication skills and the ability to present technical insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Fluent in English (French is a plus).
Availability to work from the office at least once a week.
Experience with cloud-based platforms and agile methodologies is an advantage.
Familiarity with laboratory workflows, scientific data handling, and regulatory standards is desirable.

We are looking for a Medior Data Scientist to join our team and support the rollout of a cutting-edge data reduction system for a prominent pharma client. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a large-scale data strategy, helping to shape data structures, integrate data, and develop new analytical functionalities to enhance data visualization.


As part of the Data Strategy &
column2:
Reduction Group, you will play a pivotal role in improving analytical capabilities, ensuring robust data transformation, and enabling seamless integration across systems. Your work will directly support the broader data strategy, delivering actionable insights and driving innovation in the pharmaceutical sector.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and optimize data models to support data reduction and insights generation.
  • Manage and integrate efficient data pipelines.
  • Collaborate with business analysts to understand data requirements and provide effective technical solutions.
  • Implement advanced analytical models and statistical techniques to enhance data processing and visualization, specifically within Spotfire.
  • Design and deploy automated workflows for scalable, impactful insights.
  • Contribute to data quality initiatives, including anomaly detection, data cleansing, and validation.
  • Develop and refine best practices for data science applications in a pharmaceutical environment.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior team members (if applicable).


What We're Looking For:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Bioinformatics).
  • 3+ years of experience in data science, preferably in the life sciences or pharmaceutical sector.
  • Strong expertise in data management, visualization, and analytics concepts.
  • Proficiency with Tibco software platform, especially for data visualization (Tibco Spotfire, Tableau, Power BI are a plus).
  • Solid programming skills in Python, R, or SQL.
  • Experience with large datasets, ETL processes, and optimizing data pipelines.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data challenges into clear, actionable solutions.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to present technical insights to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Fluent in English (French is a plus).
  • Availability to work from the office at least once a week.
  • Experience with cloud-based platforms and agile methodologies is an advantage.
  • Familiarity with laboratory workflows, scientific data handling, and regulatory standards is desirable.


Contract Details

  • 6-12 month Contract (Extendable)
  • Work with leading Pharma
  • Daily Rate: 350€-400€
  • Start Date: May 2025
  • Interviews as soon as possible


Interested? Apply Now!

Develop data pipelines and workflows for large-scale data processing
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business challenges and define data science objectives

🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!


At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change
column2:
we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of digital experiences?


About the job


🤠 What you'll be doing

  • Design and implement machine learning models to solve complex business problems
  • Develop data pipelines and workflows for large-scale data processing
  • Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business challenges and define data science objectives
  • Create and maintain predictive models, optimization algorithms, and statistical analyses
  • Communicate findings and recommendations through compelling visualizations and reports
  • Stay current with advancements in machine learning and data science methodologies
  • Test, validate, and fine-tune models for accuracy and scalability
  • Work closely with data engineers to ensure data integrity and availability
  • Contribute to the development of the company’s data strategy and best practices


🤓 Skills &
column3:
qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience in a data science or related role
  • Proficiency in Python or R, with a strong understanding of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
  • Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large datasets
  • Solid understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and probability
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control systems (e.g., Git)
  • Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
  • A proactive and innovative mindset with attention to detail
  • Fluent in French or Dutch with good command of English
  • A passion for turning data into actionable insights


😍 Movify offers

  • Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology and business
  • Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
  • A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
  • A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
  • Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
  • Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
  • State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
  • A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
  • Regular team-building activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

4198025079,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-f-h-x-at-national-bank-of-belgium-4198025079?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=ZDexsAcqGckDAr8FNOl2KA%3D%3D,Data Scientist (F/H/X),National Bank of Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Le Data Science Centre (DSC) est une équipe dynamique rattachée au Data & Analytics Office (GO) qui s'emploie à améliorer les produits et les services de la Banque en utilisant des techniques avancées de science des données. Le DSC fonctionne comme un centre d'expertise, composé de dix collègues possédant des connaissances approfondies dans divers domaines de la science des données. Le DSC met son expertise à la disposition de l'ensemble de la Banque et collabore avec d'autres banques centrales chaque fois que cela est possible, de sorte que les technologies utilisées et les domaines d'application sont très variés et en constante évolution.
Travailler au sein du DSC implique de constamment maintenir à jour son expertise en science des données et de la mobiliser pour contribuer aux missions de la Banque.

vous suivez les évolutions dans le domaine de la science des données, en particulier des possibilités et des limites des méthodes quantitatives (analyse des séries chronologiques, apprentissage automatique et IA, statistiques, mathématiques, etc.
vous êtes disposé(e) à vous former continuellement à ces techniques, vous les comprenez et vous expliquez leurs avantages et/ou leurs inconvénients à vos collègues

vous étudiez des problèmes concrets et collaborez à leur résolution au sein de diverses entités de la Banque, vous fournissez un coaching à vos collègues et vous tâchez de déceler et de mettre en œuvre des composants génériques en vue d'une utilisation transversale
vous documentez les solutions et encouragez l'utilisation des composantes transversales dans d'autres entités de la Banque, par exemple en offrant une formation dans le cadre de la Data Academy
vous vous assurez que les solutions élaborées soient mises en œuvre correctement par le biais d'un coaching ou d'une formation
vous tenez compte des principes d'Enterprise Data Management (EDM), vous les expliquez à vos collègues – le cas échéant – et vous les appliquez
vous recherchez, en collaboration avec vos collègues, des solutions créatives et innovantes aux problèmes qui se posent

vous assurez une diffusion optimale au sein de la Banque des connaissances en matière de science des données, notamment en contribuant de manière substantielle et organisationnelle au bon fonctionnement de la communauté de la science des données de la Banque
vous entretenez un réseau composé de partenaires potentiels de la sphère universitaire et d'autres banques centrales
vous disposez d'une solide formation en statistiques, en mathématiques et en informatique, complétée par l'expérience pertinente nécessaire pour cette fonction
vous justifiez d'une bonne connaissance de l'analyse des séries temporelles ou vous êtes disposé(e) à en apprendre davantage sur le sujet
vous justifiez d'une bonne connaissance de l'intelligence artificielle (surtout ‘genAI') ou vous êtes disposé(e) à en apprendre davantage sur le sujet

vous possédez des compétences didactiques permettant d'expliquer les tenants et les aboutissants des techniques (souvent complexes) utilisées, en adaptant votre discours au niveau de connaissance du groupe cible
vous avez une bonne connaissance de Python ou de R
la connaissance des technologies suivantes est un atout : composants des sciences des données disponibles dans Azure, Databricks et MLOps
l'utilisation et l'explication de techniques mathématiques (statistiques, algorithmes, apprentissage automatique, etc.) ne vous effraient pas
vous disposez des connaissances nécessaires pour mettre au point des solutions qui répondent aux exigences en matière de sécurité informatique et de confidentialité des données
le développement de solutions innovantes dans un environnement en constante évolution suscite votre curiosité et vous passionne
vous maintenez vos connaissances à jour et vous vous formez volontiers dans différents domaines de la science des données
vous pouvez travailler tant dans une équipe multidisciplinaire que de manière autonome

vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme universitaire (master), ou vous pouvez justifier d'une expérience probante: les diplômes d'informaticien, d'ingénieur en science: physique, mathématiques, statistiques, commercial, sont préférables
vous possédez une bonne connaissance du français, du néerlandais et de l'anglais (niveau B1)

Un salaire attractif et de nombreux avantages extra-légaux (assurance groupe, assurance hospitalisation, iPhone avec abonnement...) avec un bon équilibre vie professionnelle et vie privée et la possibilité de travailler à domicile

Une véritable carrière, la BNB vous offre la possibilité d'un développement continu. Nous vous proposons un large éventail de formations pour acquérir les compétences qui vous aideront à faire évoluer votre carrière
Un métier unique où nous mettons nos connaissances et notre expertise au service de la société
Un lieu où vous pouvez prendre des initiatives et où vous êtes encouragé(e) à montrer ce dont vous êtes capable
Une atmosphère de travail agréable, collégiale et dynamique

L'attention portée à votre bien-être : pour que vous vous sentiez bien sur votre lieu de travail et à la maison, la BNB propose un large éventail d'activités sportives (salle de fitness, cours collectifs...), d'activités culturelles et d'ateliers inspirants.

Seront uniquement prises en considération les candidatures accompagnées d'une lettre de motivation, d'un CV et d'une copie du/des diplôme (s). Les diplômes étrangers ne sont valables qu'accompagnés d'une attestation d'équivalence.
Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

column2:
Analytics Office (GO) qui s'emploie à améliorer les produits et les services de la Banque en utilisant des techniques avancées de science des données.   • le développement de solutions innovantes dans un environnement en constante évolution suscite votre curiosité et vous passionne

4192038057,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-engie-global-energy-management-sales-gems-4192038057?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=CC%2F8Ay3yGNP9JLxQOYK3QQ%3D%3D,Data Scientist,ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS),"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity ""Global Energy Management & Sales"" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group’s large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.
At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.
More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The position belongs to the Quantitative Data Analysts team in Belgium (Brussels) specifically dedicated to assist the management of risks for belgian B2C and B2B Energy Suppliers. As a member of the quantitative analysts community of the Business Platform Downstream, one can also contribute to transversal projects impacting the activity of other commercial BUs. The main missions associated with the position are :
Based on data collection and analysis, to build models, tools, processes and data representations, that are used to manage the commodity risks linked to the dynamics of a Supply portfolio
The purpose of this work is to operate and optimize costing, forecasting, sourcing and hedging strategies, within a defined mandate

The quantitative analyst / data scientist will do the design, but also the development and ensure the delivery of these models and tools. Beyond that, he will also provide scientific expertise for bespoke analysis, related to data or models. Role:
The daily responsibilities of the new role will include:
Contribute to the development of the tools, models, process and portfolio/data representation used for
Representation of all commodity exposures and associated risks (evolution of the commercial position, climatic impact on short term consumption forecasts, ...)
Ensure the run of models and derived operations
Provide BUs B2C and B2B Belgium with a deep knowledge of its commodity sales portfolios (Natural Gas, Power and Certificates) and optimally structure the portfolio representation
Use large range of data to ensure correct representation
Promote good practice, especially around data and code
Ensure code quality by following general rules and standards
Interact with other quantitative analysts/data scientists, to exchange about models, data, business or technical topics beyond the team
Strong scientific background: mathematics (probability/statistics), data science, machine learning, ideally with good command of time series forecasting
Strong skills in software (ideally Python) programming and related tools (versioning, etc.)
Willingness to embrace data handling and operational analytics
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues to non-experts in a simple and pedagogic way
Interest for the Energy markets and Energy-transition topics
Knowledge of modern data science platforms and engines such as Databricks and Spark is a plus
Team-player, Transparent, Favor collaboration and working together
University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or Physics
Ideally 1-2 years of experience in the development of modelling tools, ideally with a good knowledge of electricity & gas markets
F lu ent in En g lish
If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!
Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals. All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

4149733613,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-fr-at-nmbs-sncb-4149733613?position=10&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=EkYGHnx0icHIhwwMWvJ6ZQ%3D%3D,Data Scientist _FR,NMBS-SNCB,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Comment pouvez-vous faire la différence ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist au sein de notre Direction Customer Services, vous jouez un rôle clé dans l’analyse de nos bases de données afin de définir la stratégie commerciale pour le clients B2B et B2C de la SNCB, tant au niveau national qu’international. Vous rejoignez le département Customer Data, responsable de l'analyse des données clients, de l'automatisation du marketing et de la gestion des données clients.
Quel est votre rôle à la SNCB ?

Au sein du département Customer Data, vous serez responsable de l'analyse d'ensembles de données volumineux et complexes, du développement de modèles prédictifs et de la fourniture d'informations qui soutiennent les décisions stratégiques de la SNCB.
Vous développez de nouveaux modèles stratégiques et marketing et améliorer les modèles existants (ex: modèle de prospection pour le segment B2B pour les Account Managers).
Vous analysez et interprétez les données des voyageurs pour fournir des informations stratégiques à certains Head of d’autres départements.
Vous développez des visuels et des rapports dans des outils tels que Power BI pour présenter les résultats de manière claire, syntétique, accessible et convainquante.
Vous effectuez des analyses de données géographiques et spatiales et vous soutenez les analyses de transport.
Vous collaborez de manière transversale au sein de l'entreprise. Vous agissez en tant que conseiller et personne de confiance en matière de données clients.

Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme de master (ou équivalent par expérience) dans une orientation pertinente (par exemple, analyse de données, statistiques, géographie, économie, ingénieur civil, ... ) ET vous disposez ’au moins 3 ans d’expérience comme Data Analyst.
Vous vous reconnaissez dans les compétences suivantes:
Vous maîtrisez les techniques d'analyse mutlivariables et avez de l'expérience dans la gestion et l'analyse de données géographiques.
Vous êtes capable d'utiliser des outils de visualisation et d'analyse de données tels que Power BI et PySpark.
En tant qu’excellent communicateur, vous savez expliquer clairement et efficacement des idées complexes à différents interlocuteurs.
Vous pouvez diriger des projets techniquement complexes et coacher vos collègues pour atteindre les objectifs fixés.
Vous êtes capable de résoudre des problèmes de manière creative et dans la collaboration avec des équipes transversales au sein de la SNCB.
Vous vous adaptez facilement aux besoins du projet et aux attentes des parties prenantes internes.
Vous comprenez une conversation en néerlandais.

Chaque personne est unique. Il est important pour nous que vous puissiez être vous-même. C’est ce qui rend la SNCB plus forte. C’est pourquoi nous accordons beaucoup d’importance à la diversité et à l’inclusion.

En tant que Senior Data Scientist, vous choisissez un job qui a un impact sur la stratégie commerciale de la SNCB. Vous vous trouverez dans un environnement de travail agréable, avec une pertinence sociétale et vous êtes entouré de collègues motivés et sympathiques.
En outre, vous pouvez compter sur :
Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13e mois, d'une indemnité de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, d’une voiture flex, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.
Vous travaillez à Bruxelles dans la Direction Customer Services, à proximité de la gare de Bruxelles-Midi et à domicile. Vous rejoignez l’équipe Customer Data composée de 8 personnes.
Nous analysons votre CV et votre motivation.
Nous vous invitons à un entretien de sélection (en ligne). Afin de préparer cet entretien, nous vous demanderons de compléter un questionnaire de personnalité et un test de raisonnement en ligne.
Dans un second temps, et afin de vous donner une bonne idée de la fonction, nous vous soumettrons un case study éliminatoire.
Si le case study est concluant, un deuxième entretien sera organisé si nécessaire.
Tout se déroule de manière positive ? Nous vous faisons une proposition de contrat.
Vous êtes prêt·e pour votre premier jour de travail !
Sur le contenu de la fonction

Comment pouvez-vous faire la différence ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist au sein de notre Direction Customer Services, vous jouez un rôle clé dans l’analyse de nos bases de données afin de définir la stratégie commerciale pour le clients B2B et B2C de la SNCB, tant au niveau national qu’international. Vous rejoignez le département Customer Data, responsable de l'analyse des données clients, de l'automatisation du marketing et de la gestion des données clients.

Quel est votre rôle à la SNCB ?

Au sein du département Customer Data, vous serez responsable de l'analyse d'ensembles de données volumineux et complexes, du développement de modèles prédictifs et de la fourniture d'informations qui soutiennent les décisions stratégiques de la SNCB.

En tant que Data Scientist:

  • Vous développez de nouveaux modèles stratégiques et marketing et améliorer les modèles existants (ex: modèle de prospection pour le segment B2B pour les Account Managers).
  • Vous analysez et interprétez les données des voyageurs pour fournir des informations stratégiques à certains Head of d’autres départements.
  • Vous développez des visuels et des rapports dans des outils tels que Power BI pour présenter les résultats de manière claire, syntétique, accessible et convainquante.
  • Vous effectuez des analyses de données géographiques et spatiales et vous soutenez les analyses de transport.
  • Vous collaborez de manière transversale au sein de l'entreprise. Vous agissez en tant que conseiller et personne de confiance en matière de données clients.

Un job fait pour vous ?

  • Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme de master (ou équivalent par expérience) dans une orientation pertinente (par exemple, analyse de données, statistiques, géographie, économie, ingénieur civil, ... ) ET vous disposez ’au moins 3 ans d’expérience comme Data Analyst.

Vous vous reconnaissez dans les compétences suivantes:

  • Vous maîtrisez les techniques d'analyse mutlivariables et avez de l'expérience dans la gestion et l'analyse de données géographiques.
  • Vous êtes capable d'utiliser des outils de visualisation et d'analyse de données tels que Power BI et PySpark.
  • En tant qu’excellent communicateur, vous savez expliquer clairement et efficacement des idées complexes à différents interlocuteurs.
  • Vous pouvez diriger des projets techniquement complexes et coacher vos collègues pour atteindre les objectifs fixés.
  • Vous êtes capable de résoudre des problèmes de manière creative et dans la collaboration avec des équipes transversales au sein de la SNCB.
  • Vous vous adaptez facilement aux besoins du projet et aux attentes des parties prenantes internes.
  • Vous comprenez une conversation en néerlandais.

Chaque personne est unique. Il est important pour nous que vous puissiez être vous-même. C’est ce qui rend la SNCB plus forte. C’est pourquoi nous accordons beaucoup d’importance à la diversité et à l’inclusion.

Qu'avons-nous à vous offrir ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist, vous choisissez un job qui a un impact sur la stratégie commerciale de la SNCB. Vous vous trouverez dans un environnement de travail agréable, avec une pertinence sociétale et vous êtes entouré de collègues motivés et sympathiques.

En outre, vous pouvez compter sur :

  • Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13e mois, d'une indemnité de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
  • Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, d’une voiture flex, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
  • Une assurance hospitalisation et collective.
  • Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
  • Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
  • Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.

Où allez-vous travailler ?

Vous travaillez à Bruxelles dans la Direction Customer Services, à proximité de la gare de Bruxelles-Midi et à domicile. Vous rejoignez l’équipe Customer Data composée de 8 personnes.

What’s next ?

  • Vous postulez sur notre jobsite
  • Nous analysons votre CV et votre motivation.
  • Nous vous invitons à un entretien de sélection (en ligne). Afin de préparer cet entretien, nous vous demanderons de compléter un questionnaire de personnalité et un test de raisonnement en ligne.
  • Dans un second temps, et afin de vous donner une bonne idée de la fonction, nous vous soumettrons un case study éliminatoire.
  • Si le case study est concluant, un deuxième entretien sera organisé si nécessaire.
  • Tout se déroule de manière positive ? Nous vous faisons une proposition de contrat.
  • Vous êtes prêt·e pour votre premier jour de travail !

Avez-vous encore des questions?

Jobreq: 50260

4156956547,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-scientist-at-n-side-4156956547?position=11&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=IiLqqBrRl1mN3eKcMck%2F9w%3D%3D,Junior Data Scientist,N-SIDE,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"N-SIDE Careers Junior Data Scientist
We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our Energy department based in Louvain-la-Neuve.

N-SIDE is a world leader in increasing the efficiency of life sciences and energy industries by providing software and services that optimize the use of natural resources, facilitating the transition to a more sustainable world.

To achieve this, N-SIDE leverages its deep industry knowledge, technical expertise, and understanding of applied mathematics to help global pharmaceutical and energy companies anticipate, adapt, and optimize their decisions.
In the energy industry, N-SIDE helps electricity market and grid operators in enabling a safer and faster transition toward renewable sources.

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be part of our Energy team. You will deliver machine learning-based software solutions and consultancy services. You will contribute to innovative and challenging advanced analytics projects for various European Transmission System operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, helping the different actors better address the complex challenges of the energy transition.

You will provide hands-on contributions to analytical projects for various European Transmission System Operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, as part of our internal projects teams of power market experts and energy data scientists

You will develop AI-based Python prototypes, maintain and improve production code, perform data engineering tasks (e.g. extract, transform, load), run simulations, analyze results, and extract key findings. While most projects will have a strong data science focus, you may also be exposed to other analytical techniques (e.g. optimization, power flow simulations) depending on business needs and priorities.
You will communicate insights effectively by preparing reports, slides, and presentations for our customers that translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations.
You will engage with customers to understand their needs, gather feedback, and propose improvements and ideas while explaining advanced analytics concepts in a clear, and business-oriented manner.
You will contribute to the maintenance, support, and continuous improvement of our in-house forecasting solution based on Machine Learning

You will support clients in their use of our Energy applications. This will constitute a minor portion of your responsibilities, yet may occasionally (one weekend every five weeks) require completion outside of regular business hours (with additional compensation and/or benefits provided).
You hold a Master’s degree in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Energy Economics, or a related field, with a strong focus on Data Science.
You are a young graduate or have a maximum of 1-2 years years of experience
You have a solid foundation in machine learning and artificial intelligence, with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for the field
You are proficient in Python and can efficiently develop prototypes to perform data-driven analyses.
You can effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, demonstrating a customer-focused approach and a genuine enthusiasm for assisting users.
You possess strong written and verbal communication skills and can clearly articulate insights and findings.
You are customer-oriented, results-driven, and have a problem-solving mindset
You are curious, proactive, and a strong team player, eager to collaborate and continuously learn.

You are interested in expanding your knowledge of the energy sector, particularly in electricity markets and power system operations. While prior experience in the field is a plus, it is not required.
You have fully professional proficiency in English

At N-SIDE, we develop leaders. What’s important for us is that you grow and learn, because we care about you, which is N-SIDE’s hallmark.You will be part of a fun and flexible work environment in which creativity, freedom and initiative are rewarded.

You will join a diverse team of over 200 passionate engineers, computer scientists, and business experts from 30+ different nationalities, with 25% holding PhDs. Together, we are committed to making a meaningful impact toward a more sustainable future.
N-SIDE offers a great compensation package, which includes a company car and full range of benefits which can be personalised thanks to our Flex Income Plan.

At N-SIDE we value diversity. All candidates will be treated equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, disability, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. N-SIDE will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.
We are headquartered in Belgium with offices in the USA and Japan. The company is certified B Corporation, Best Managed Company by Deloitte Belgium, ISO 14001 and ISO 27001.
Motivated to join our team and bring N-SIDE to the next level?
We are looking forward to receiving your application!

We are committed to respecting your privacy and protecting your personal data, including any information which allows us to identify you as an individual person. N-SIDE uses the applicant’s personal data in a fair and lawful manner. N-SIDE collects and processes personal data in accordance with the privacy statement available in the privacy policy. Personal information (applicant data) submitted by an applicant will only be used by N-SIDE to ensure an effective recruitment process and will be used for recruitment purposes only.

N-SIDE Careers Junior Data Scientist

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our Energy department based in Louvain-la-Neuve.

Who We Are

N-SIDE is a world leader in increasing the efficiency of life sciences and energy industries by providing software and services that optimize the use of natural resources, facilitating the transition to a more sustainable world.

To achieve this, N-SIDE leverages its deep industry knowledge, technical expertise, and understanding of applied mathematics to help global pharmaceutical and energy companies anticipate, adapt, and optimize their decisions.

In the energy industry, N-SIDE helps electricity market and grid operators in enabling a safer and faster transition toward renewable sources.

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be part of our Energy team. You will deliver machine learning-based software solutions and consultancy services. You will contribute to innovative and challenging advanced analytics projects for various European Transmission System operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, helping the different actors better address the complex challenges of the energy transition.

What You’ll Do

  • You will provide hands-on contributions to analytical projects for various European Transmission System Operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, as part of our internal projects teams of power market experts and energy data scientists
  • You will develop AI-based Python prototypes, maintain and improve production code, perform data engineering tasks (e.g. extract, transform, load), run simulations, analyze results, and extract key findings. While most projects will have a strong data science focus, you may also be exposed to other analytical techniques (e.g. optimization, power flow simulations) depending on business needs and priorities.
  • You will communicate insights effectively by preparing reports, slides, and presentations for our customers that translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations.
  • You will engage with customers to understand their needs, gather feedback, and propose improvements and ideas while explaining advanced analytics concepts in a clear, and business-oriented manner.
  • You will contribute to the maintenance, support, and continuous improvement of our in-house forecasting solution based on Machine Learning
  • You will support clients in their use of our Energy applications. This will constitute a minor portion of your responsibilities, yet may occasionally (one weekend every five weeks) require completion outside of regular business hours (with additional compensation and/or benefits provided).

About You

  • You hold a Master’s degree in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Energy Economics, or a related field, with a strong focus on Data Science.
  • You are a young graduate or have a maximum of 1-2 years years of experience
  • You have a solid foundation in machine learning and artificial intelligence, with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for the field
  • You are proficient in Python and can efficiently develop prototypes to perform data-driven analyses.
  • You can effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, demonstrating a customer-focused approach and a genuine enthusiasm for assisting users.
  • You possess strong written and verbal communication skills and can clearly articulate insights and findings.
  • You are customer-oriented, results-driven, and have a problem-solving mindset
  • You are curious, proactive, and a strong team player, eager to collaborate and continuously learn.
  • You are interested in expanding your knowledge of the energy sector, particularly in electricity markets and power system operations. While prior experience in the field is a plus, it is not required.
  • You have fully professional proficiency in English

Travel: 0%

Start date: ASAP

Our offer

At N-SIDE, we develop leaders. What’s important for us is that you grow and learn, because we care about you, which is N-SIDE’s hallmark.You will be part of a fun and flexible work environment in which creativity, freedom and initiative are rewarded.

You will join a diverse team of over 200 passionate engineers, computer scientists, and business experts from 30+ different nationalities, with 25% holding PhDs. Together, we are committed to making a meaningful impact toward a more sustainable future.

N-SIDE offers a great compensation package, which includes a company car and full range of benefits which can be personalised thanks to our Flex Income Plan.

At N-SIDE we value diversity. All candidates will be treated equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, disability, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. N-SIDE will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

We are headquartered in Belgium with offices in the USA and Japan. The company is certified B Corporation, Best Managed Company by Deloitte Belgium, ISO 14001 and ISO 27001.

Motivated to join our team and bring N-SIDE to the next level?

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

We are committed to respecting your privacy and protecting your personal data, including any information which allows us to identify you as an individual person. N-SIDE uses the applicant’s personal data in a fair and lawful manner. N-SIDE collects and processes personal data in accordance with the privacy statement available in the privacy policy. Personal information (applicant data) submitted by an applicant will only be used by N-SIDE to ensure an effective recruitment process and will be used for recruitment purposes only.

The AI Scientist at Keytrade Bank is a critical role in leveraging the potential of artificial intelligence to drive innovation, efficiency, and compliance within the bank. This individual will design, develop, and maintain AI systems while addressing governance, compliance, and ethical considerations. They will also enhance existing AI products and integrate advanced cloud-based technologies, ensuring Keytrade Bank remains a leader in the responsible and effective use of AI within the financial sector.
The AI Scientist will report to the AI Innovation Lead and collaborate closely with the data feature team.
Design, implement and test AI models to enhance decision-making, customer experiences, and operational efficiencies.
Maintain, optimize and test existing AI solutions, ensuring they adapt to emerging technologies and evolving business needs.
Collaborate with teams to integrate AI systems with UI technologies, such as Mendix, to enhance usability and functionality.
Implement and enhance MLOps/DevOps best practices for streamlined development, deployment, and monitoring of AI solutions.
Ensure responsible and ethical use of AI at Keytrade Bank, following guidelines of EU regulations (EU AI Act, GDPR…)
Help in establishing policies to govern the lifecycle of AI models, including accountability, fairness, and transparency.
Work with cross-functional teams to embed governance practices into the deployment of AI systems.
Collaborate with internal security and risk teams to assess and mitigate AI-related risks.
Stay informed about emerging trends in AI and cloud computing to recommend innovative solutions.
Translate technical AI concepts into actionable insights for stakeholders, including non-technical teams.
Support product teams in implementing AI-driven solutions and aligning them with business objectives.
Provide insights on AI products, data and AI governance, and emerging technology trends to colleagues and stakeholders through targeted workshops and “lunch and learn” sessions.
Participate in training sessions, conferences, and industry events to enhance professional growth.
Provide training sessions as trainer in our data & AI Academy.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and familiarity with machine learning libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlo

eld.2–6 years of experience in AI or data science roles, preferably within the banking or financial industry.
Keytrade Bank is a young and dynamic organization with a lean structure, that evolves in an Agile ecosystem. The tempo and the atmosphere are upbeat and no day goes by without an element of fun!
The company works in an agile setup with a lot of flexibility regarding remote work. This means that you will be guaranteed at least 50% homework with a high degree of flexibility.
Offices are in Watermael-Boitsfort in a peaceful, green surrounding.
A competitive salary with extra-legal advantages such as meal vouchers, group insurance, health insurance and many other.
Continued education and access to trainings.
Stepping stone for a continued career within Keytrade Bank.
Open, inclusive culture and dynamic working environment.

Purpose

The AI Scientist at Keytrade Bank is a critical role in leveraging the potential of artificial intelligence to drive innovation, efficiency, and compliance within the bank. This individual will design, develop, and maintain AI systems while addressing governance, compliance, and ethical considerations. They will also enhance existing AI products and integrate advanced cloud-based technologies, ensuring Keytrade Bank remains a leader in the responsible and effective use of AI within the financial sector.



Reporting Line

The AI Scientist will report to the AI Innovation Lead and collaborate closely with the data feature team.



Responsibilities

  • Design, implement and test AI models to enhance decision-making, customer experiences, and operational efficiencies.
  • Maintain, optimize and test existing AI solutions, ensuring they adapt to emerging technologies and evolving business needs.
  • Collaborate with teams to integrate AI systems with UI technologies, such as Mendix, to enhance usability and functionality.
  • Implement and enhance MLOps/DevOps best practices for streamlined development, deployment, and monitoring of AI solutions.
  • Ensure responsible and ethical use of AI at Keytrade Bank, following guidelines of EU regulations (EU AI Act, GDPR…)
  • Help in establishing policies to govern the lifecycle of AI models, including accountability, fairness, and transparency.
  • Work with cross-functional teams to embed governance practices into the deployment of AI systems.
  • Collaborate with internal security and risk teams to assess and mitigate AI-related risks.
  • Stay informed about emerging trends in AI and cloud computing to recommend innovative solutions.
  • Translate technical AI concepts into actionable insights for stakeholders, including non-technical teams.
  • Support product teams in implementing AI-driven solutions and aligning them with business objectives.
  • Provide insights on AI products, data and AI governance, and emerging technology trends to colleagues and stakeholders through targeted workshops and “lunch and learn” sessions.
  • Participate in training sessions, conferences, and industry events to enhance professional growth.

4199648788,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-procter-gamble-4199648788?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=pQloPnbM%2B%2BD0UpdMJF9Ngg%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Procter & Gamble,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Job Location
Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science groups in the industry, developing advanced AI, ML and optimization algorithms, and applying Operations Research techniques?
Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously?

A career in IT Data Science & Analytics at P&G will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and will provide you a breadth of experience across multiple internal businesses and type of work (whether you do Analytics for Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain).
As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope, and operates across P&G’s supply chains.
Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE .
Our Data Scientists in IT Data & Analytics at P&G are:

Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa
column2: you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.

column1: Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.

Technically Capable: Data Scientists “roll up their sleeves”, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.
YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:
A Master in a quantitative degree (Operation Research, Statistics, Systems Engineering, Decision Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.)
Strong technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc)
Great leadership skills, problem solving and priority setting
Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams
have passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics
preferably have some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting
column2: can demonstrate success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action.

column1: A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package
Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction
Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan

Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities
Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employees’ commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

  • Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&
column9: G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa
column10:
you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.
  • Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.
  • Technically Capable: Data Scientists “roll up their sleeves”, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.

    YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:
