4199652387,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-science-internship-at-procter-gamble-4199652387?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=RKX4z38wyuIzyo6sWvHK%2BA%3D%3D,Data Science Internship,Procter & Gamble,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Job Location

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously? Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science & Analytics group in the industry, developing sophisticated mathematical models and algorithms and applying Operations Research techniques?

Then join P&G as a Data Science intern for Supply Chain! Through your internship, you will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and learn how to work across domains and functions to make P&G’s supply chain more performant, more resilient and more sustainable.
Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE.
AS A DATA SCIENCE FOR SUPPLY CHAIN INTERN, YOU WILL:

Influence decisions from daily through to strategic ones, made across functions, at all levels of leadership, to have a meaningful impact on the performance, resiliency and environmental footprint of one of the largest CPG companies in the world
Build the next generation of supply chain analytics, using:
Mathematical modeling techniques: decision analysis, optimization, machine learning, simulation etc.
Programming languages (at least one of these): Python, SQL, R, Hive/Impala, MATLAB, etc.
Data Visualization: Power BI, Tableau, etc.
Work with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytical solutions
Communicate insights from complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive
Belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope and operates across P&G’s supply chains.
YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU:
Are currently pursuing a Master's degree in a quantitative field (Engineering, Statistics, Operation Research, Decisions Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics, Data Science, etc.)

Have strong analytical skills and proficiency in at least one programming language (R, Python, SQL, etc.) or family of techniques (optimization, simulation, machine learning, predictive modeling, etc.)
Are adaptable and able to handle multiple priorities effectively, both independently and as part of a collaborative team
Are proficient in English, both written and spoken
We are offering internships of at least 3 months throughout the year.
If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.
A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package
Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction

Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities
Flexibility in terms of working hours
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

4202543307,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/full-remote-junior-data-scientist-ai-%E2%82%AC50k-%E2%82%AC80k-at-joinrs-uk-4202543307?position=16&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=%2FC%2Fyo99OnAiBw2sVah%2Flhw%3D%3D,[Full Remote] Junior Data Scientist & AI (€50k-€80k),Joinrs UK,European Union,"Our goal is to help every recent graduate worldwide find a job that aligns with their ambitions: join us to make the aspirations of a community of over 1,000,000 users come true!

We are constantly looking for students, recent graduates, and junior professionals who aspire to join our team around Europe. Apply for this position, and our HR team will contact you as soon as a role in this area becomes available and your CV matches the profile we are seeking.

For all Junior positions in the Tech Field, we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: €50k-€80k) in the EMEA Region, you will have the opportunity to grow exponentially thanks to on-the-job training, you will be able to work fully remote for as long as you want and we will equip you with a latest generation MacBook.
We are looking only for Junior profiles, with 0 to 3 years of experience.
Within the team, you may be responsible for one or more of the following tasks:

Implementation of Machine Learning Algorithms: You will have the opportunity to implement and test machine learning algorithms, contributing to the development of intelligent solutions for business challenges. Specifically, working alongside our tech team, you will be involved in Joinrs AI: our Artificial Intelligence model that assists our community in finding employment.
Data Analysis and Modeling: You will participate in data analysis, developing predictive models and contributing to provide meaningful insights to enhance business decisions.

Data Visualization: You will learn to create clear and informative data visualizations to effectively communicate complex results to various stakeholders. In particular, you will create interactive dashboards to showcase data and Key Performance Indicators (Data Visualization) to the team, clients, investors, and all key stakeholders.
Optimization of Business Processes: You will collaborate in identifying and optimizing business processes through the application of data-driven solutions.

Participation in Technological Brainstorming Sessions: You will be involved in brainstorming sessions to generate innovative ideas and contribute to identifying new opportunities in the field of Artificial Intelligence.

Continuous Training and Updates on the Latest Trends: You will have access to continuous training programs to stay updated on the latest trends and advancements in the fields of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.
Working in the Joinrs team means being able to choose the best psychophysical conditions for tranquility and productivity. This translates into:
Remote working and flexibility. You'll have the opportunity to work remotely full-time, but you can also use one of our offices.

Dynamic work environment. Our offices remain open, providing shared workspaces, meeting rooms, break areas, and a bar with fresh fruit and various snacks. You'll also find a foosball table and a gaming station. We aim for an informal work environment that encourages shared moments, always respecting individual activities.
Team building & fun. We frequently organize aperitifs, games, and leisure moments, which are integral parts of life at Joinrs, both inside and outside the office.
Company welfare. We guarantee you a company welfare package that meets your expectations.
Tech pack. You'll use advanced software and modern technologies, and you'll be provided with the latest-generation MacBook.

Training. You'll always have a mentor in your Joinrs journey, acting as a reference for both technical and team aspects. We ensure constant professional growth with progressively increasing responsibilities. You can participate in industry events and training courses, along with continuous education on the best e-learning platforms.
Social Impact. Your contribution will support thousands of recent graduates in finding the job they aspire to.
Our mission is to support every recent graduate and junior professional in achieving their goals, helping them start their careers with optimism and a clear vision for their future.
We are a united team that strongly believes in collaboration: together we work, discuss, and achieve results that inspire us to aim for ever more ambitious goals.
Our community includes over 1,000,000 members across the US, UK, Europe, and Brazil, as well as 300+ companies like PwC, Accenture, Gi Group, Danone, and Siemens. And we’re growing fast—join us!
For all Junior positions we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: €50k-€80k).
Salary reviews are scheduled every six months, with your compensation increasing rapidly as you gain experience and translate it into a more significant impact.
CV Screening: The first step is a curriculum vitae (CV) screening (usually within 20 days of application).
Phone Interview: The second step involves a 15-minute phone interview with our HR Manager.
Video Interview: The final step is a video interview with both the HR Manager and your future supervisor, lasting at least 45 minutes.
Social Impact: You'll have the opportunity to support our community in realizing their ambitions, as well as your own.
Successful Startup: Joinrs was selected among the top 10 startups globally at the Web Summit in Lisbon.
Exponential Personal Growth: You'll have the opportunity for exponential growth, both in hard and soft skills, thanks to a training program based on on-the-job training and online support.

Our goal is to help every recent graduate worldwide find a job that aligns with their ambitions: join us to make the aspirations of a community of over 1,000,000 users come true!


We are constantly looking for students, recent graduates, and junior professionals who aspire to join our team around Europe. Apply for this position, and our HR team will contact you as soon as a role in this area becomes available and your CV matches the profile we are seeking.


For all Junior positions in the Tech Field, we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: €50k-€80k) in the EMEA Region, you will have the opportunity to grow exponentially thanks to on-the-job training, you will be able to work fully remote for as long as you want and we will equip you with a latest generation MacBook.


We are looking only for Junior profiles, with 0 to 3 years of experience.

--


Responsibilities:

Within the team, you may be responsible for one or more of the following tasks:

  • Implementation of Machine Learning Algorithms: You will have the opportunity to implement and test machine learning algorithms, contributing to the development of intelligent solutions for business challenges. Specifically, working alongside our tech team, you will be involved in Joinrs AI: our Artificial Intelligence model that assists our community in finding employment.
  • Data Analysis and Modeling: You will participate in data analysis, developing predictive models and contributing to provide meaningful insights to enhance business decisions.
  • Data Visualization: You will learn to create clear and informative data visualizations to effectively communicate complex results to various stakeholders. In particular, you will create interactive dashboards to showcase data and Key Performance Indicators (Data Visualization) to the team, clients, investors, and all key stakeholders.
  • Optimization of Business Processes: You will collaborate in identifying and optimizing business processes through the application of data-driven solutions.
  • Participation in Technological Brainstorming Sessions: You will be involved in brainstorming sessions to generate innovative ideas and contribute to identifying new opportunities in the field of Artificial Intelligence.
  • Continuous Training and Updates on the Latest Trends: You will have access to continuous training programs to stay updated on the latest trends and advancements in the fields of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.


--


What We Offer:

Working in the Joinrs team means being able to choose the best psychophysical conditions for tranquility and productivity. This translates into:

  • Remote working and flexibility. You'll have the opportunity to work remotely full-time, but you can also use one of our offices.
  • Dynamic work environment. Our offices remain open, providing shared workspaces, meeting rooms, break areas, and a bar with fresh fruit and various snacks. You'll also find a foosball table and a gaming station. We aim for an informal work environment that encourages shared moments, always respecting individual activities.
  • Team building &
column2:
fun. We frequently organize aperitifs, games, and leisure moments, which are integral parts of life at Joinrs, both inside and outside the office.
  • Company welfare. We guarantee you a company welfare package that meets your expectations.
  • Tech pack. You'll use advanced software and modern technologies, and you'll be provided with the latest-generation MacBook.
  • Training. You'll always have a mentor in your Joinrs journey, acting as a reference for both technical and team aspects. We ensure constant professional growth with progressively increasing responsibilities. You can participate in industry events and training courses, along with continuous education on the best e-learning platforms.
  • Social Impact. Your contribution will support thousands of recent graduates in finding the job they aspire to.

    We are a united team that strongly believes in collaboration: together we work, discuss, and achieve results that inspire us to aim for ever more ambitious goals.


    Our community includes over 1,000,000 members across the US, UK, Europe, and Brazil, as well as 300+ companies like PwC, Accenture, Gi Group, Danone, and Siemens. And we’re growing fast—join us!

For all Junior positions we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: €50k-€80k).


Salary reviews are scheduled every six months, with your compensation increasing rapidly as you gain experience and translate it into a more significant impact.

CV Screening: The first step is a curriculum vitae (CV) screening (usually within 20 days of application).

4199454735,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-arhs-group-4199454735?position=17&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=Q6ngngZxyHEYSckv23fTYA%3D%3D,Data Scientist,ARHS Group,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Arηs Group – part of Accenture - is a market leader in the management of complex IT projects and systems. Founded in Luxembourg in 2003, we have grown to encompass 12 entities worldwide, employing over 2,500 employees in Luxembourg, Belgium, Greece, Italy, Portugal and Bulgaria. With our focus on getting things done, we help our clients achieve their goals with best-of-breed solutions, superior execution and exceptional services. We offer bespoke software development, data science, infrastructure, digital trust and mobile development to government institutions at national and European level, telecom providers, and financial institutions, among others. Our bold company culture is built around working hard and playing hard, with a flat and agile structure that lends itself to efficiency and employee empowerment. We value our diverse workplace of close-knit teams and provide a place where everyone can be supported to learn and evolve.
ARHS Group - part of Accenture - is looking for a Data Scientist for one of its clients at the EU Institutions in Brussels.
Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution
Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience
Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL)
Produces data models according to specific problems statements.
Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc…)
Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.
Bachelor’s degree with a focus on Data management or equivalent experience
Ability to work in a team as well as autonomously
Good communication skills in English, both orally and in written form
Excellent knowledge of Data Science techniques especially in machine learning and NLP. Prior experience with Large Language Model is considered an asset
Extensive experience in data analysis, with the ability to work with large datasets and extract meaningful insights
Clean and transform raw data into a usable format for analysis. This includes designing and deploying Extraction Transformation and Load (ETL) processes
Produces data models according to specific problems statements
Knowledge and experience working in cloud environments
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation
Ability to deliver presentation to both business and technical audiences
Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in application developments

Minimum 5 years of professional experience in Data Science and AI. Excellent command of Python and proficiency with relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, HuggingFace
Minimum 5 years of professional experience in the following areas 1) Oracle RDMBS Database development, 2) Data Modelling and SQL
column2: 3) ETL tools (e.g. BODI, BODS Apache Airflow, dbt)

column1: Minimum 2 year of professional experience with data visualisation and/or BI tools (e.g. Power BI)
Track record of implemented solutions that solved business problems and produced tangible results
Minimum 2 year with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset.
Minimum 2 years of experience with version control system (Git Hub)

Arηs Group – part of Accenture - is a market leader in the management of complex IT projects and systems. Founded in Luxembourg in 2003, we have grown to encompass 12 entities worldwide, employing over 2,500 employees in Luxembourg, Belgium, Greece, Italy, Portugal and Bulgaria. With our focus on getting things done, we help our clients achieve their goals with best-of-breed solutions, superior execution and exceptional services. We offer bespoke software development, data science, infrastructure, digital trust and mobile development to government institutions at national and European level, telecom providers, and financial institutions, among others. Our bold company culture is built around working hard and playing hard, with a flat and agile structure that lends itself to efficiency and employee empowerment. We value our diverse workplace of close-knit teams and provide a place where everyone can be supported to learn and evolve.



Job Description

ARHS Group - part of Accenture - is looking for a Data Scientist for one of its clients at the EU Institutions in Brussels.

Role &
column2:
Responsibilities

  • Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution
  • Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience
  • Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL)
  • Produces data models according to specific problems statements.
  • Scripting and programming.
  • Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc…)
  • Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.

Qualifications

Your profile

  • Bachelor’s degree with a focus on Data management or equivalent experience
  • Ability to work in a team as well as autonomously
  • Results-oriented mindset, focused on delivering
  • Good communication skills in English, both orally and in written form

Technical skills

  • Excellent knowledge of Data Science techniques especially in machine learning and NLP. Prior experience with Large Language Model is considered an asset
  • Extensive experience in data analysis, with the ability to work with large datasets and extract meaningful insights
  • Clean and transform raw data into a usable format for analysis. This includes designing and deploying Extraction Transformation and Load (ETL) processes
  • Produces data models according to specific problems statements
  • Knowledge and experience working in cloud environments
  • Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation
  • Ability to deliver presentation to both business and technical audiences
  • Solution-oriented and accuracy to detail
  • Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in application developments

Specific Expertise:

  • Experience with Statistics &
column3:
Data Analytics
  • Proficiency in R and Python
  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience in Data Science and AI. Excellent command of Python and proficiency with relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, HuggingFace

4130566837,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-proximus-group-4130566837?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=cBhgUuyJEEV%2FHRzEfaibzA%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Proximus Group,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","As an Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.
Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology
Translate business requests into AI applications
Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization
Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value
Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems
Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams

Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).
PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment
Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem
Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods
Experience using LLM’s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM’s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...) is an asset
Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
Translating business requests into data requirements.
Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
Any experience with following elements is a plus:
MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.
Passionate about AI and a constant learner
Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value
Team player with strong communication and presentation skills
Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers
Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.
Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

As an Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

4192081999,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-trilations-4192081999?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=J%2BTw5sqcLjB9CWoUMWyOXA%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Trilations,"Kontich, Flemish Region, Belgium","Trilations is een open-minded, no-nonsense consultancy organisatie. Wij geloven sterk in langdurig engagement, met zowel onze klanten als onze medewerkers. Wij investeren in het delen van kennis, levenslang leren en coaching en bouwen voort op onze pragmatische cultuur, die is gebaseerd op vertrouwen, professionaliteit, integriteit en betrokkenheid.
De consultants van Trilations onderscheiden zich door hun expertise en hun professionele en klantgerichte, vriendelijke houding. Momenteel zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Scientist.

De klanten van Trilations zijn Business Insights verantwoordelijken en hun team binnen toonaangevende bedrijven in de pharma sector zowel in het binnen- als buitenland (EU, LATAM, Americas and Asia). Onze consultants werken nauw samen met het team van de klant en ondersteun het team in het vertalen van hun business-uitdaging naar concrete projecten, het opzetten en uitvoeren van het analyse plan en finaal het delen van de nieuw bekomen inzichten.

In je rol als data scientist werk je nauw samen met zowel het intern project team van Trilations als het team van de klant. Je ondersteunt onze consultants in het aanleveren van waardevolle inzichten die je haalt uit analyses van omvangrijke kwantitatieve & kwalitatieve datasets afkomstig van klanten of eigen marktonderzoek. Het resultaat van je analyses helpt de klant om in te zetten op verbeteringen die het meeste ROI opleveren.
Om deze inzichten te bekomen ga je concreet aan de slag met:
Statistische technieken zoals regressie, factor analyse, clustering, etc
Machine learning technieken zoals SVM, random forests,...
Large language models om inzichten te verwerven uit teksten
Je werkt mee aan de innovatie van Trilations door het ontwikkelen van nieuwe services obv data.

Je hebt een masterdiploma in een kwantitatieve richting (Wiskunde, Statistics, Data Science, AI, IT, Ingenieurswetenschappen, Experimentele Psychologie,...). Een doctoraatservaring wordt ook in overweging genomen
Je hebt bij voorkeur een minimum van 3 jaar ervaring in een rol als scientist of analyst
Je hebt een grondige kennis van Python (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn,...) en SQL
Ervaring met LLMs en LangChain is een grote troef
Kennis van SPSS is een plus
Je analytische geest en flexibiliteit zijn belangrijk voor het uitvoeren van je job. Je hebt ook ervaring met het beheren en interpreteren van datasets voor het leveren van bruikbare inzichten
Je hebt een proactieve houding en bent in staat om zelfstandig projecten te beheren en effectief samen te werken met diverse teams binnen een organisatie
Je bent gepassioneerd door data en werkt zeer graag in een team
Je beschikt over een grote interesse in de lifesciences sector en hebt ambitie om te groeien. Ervaring en/of kennis in de pharma sector is een pluspunt.
Je krijgt een boeiende en gevarieerde functie die je de mogelijkheid biedt je expertise en vaardigheden verder uit te bouwen in een dynamisch team
De mogelijkheid om voor toonaangevende bedrijven te werken, zowel nationaal als internationaal
Een aantrekkelijk salaris met extralegale voordelen, 32 vakantiedagen en een firmawagen of mobiliteitsbudget
Een persoonlijk groeitraject in functie van je mogelijkheden en ambities.

Bij Trilations streven we naar gelijke kansen in ons rekruteringsproces, vrij van vooroordelen of discriminatie op basis van (maar niet beperkt tot) ras, kleur, religie, geslacht, genderidentiteit, seksuele geaardheid, nationaliteit, genetica, beperking of leeftijd. We creëren een bedrijfscultuur waarin iedereen zich gerespecteerd, gewaardeerd en ondersteund voelt. Zowel binnen als buiten ons bedrijf zetten we ons in voor een omgeving zonder discriminatie, waarin iedereen zichzelf kan zijn.

4195688954,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-visser-van-baars-4195688954?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=bblbiMHU4gWePflnMYCstw%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Visser & Van Baars,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","📍 Brussels, Belgium - Hybrid (2 days in-office, 3 days remote)
Make real impact with data in the world of DIY & retail

For a leading company in the DIY and home improvement retail sector in the Benelux, we are looking for an experienced Senior or Mid-level Data Scientist. With millions of customers across Belgium, the Netherlands, and Luxembourg, this organization helps people build, improve, and personalize their homes.
As they move through a major data-driven transformation, they are seeking a data expert who can turn complex data into real business value through insights and AI-powered solutions.
Turn data into business impact: Work closely with Marketing, Operations, Finance, and other departments to solve challenges using data and AI
Build end-to-end solutions: Develop and deploy machine learning models and optimize processes from A to Z
Work with big data: Analyze large and complex datasets from retail stores, e-commerce platforms, and supply chain systems
Collaborate with stakeholders: Work alongside data engineers, product owners, and external partners to deliver scalable, high-quality solutions
Translate data into insights: Communicate complex findings in a clear, actionable way to non-technical stakeholders
Stay ahead of the curve: Keep up with the latest developments in AI, machine learning, and cloud technology
Operate in an agile environment: Use Agile/Kanban methods to prioritize and deliver value efficiently
Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery), Databricks, Python, and PySpark
Skilled in Power BI for dashboarding and reporting
Experience building and deploying machine learning models
Familiarity with retail, e-commerce, or supply chain datasets
Experience with end-to-end data pipelines and putting ML models into production
Experience with SAP systems (CAR, BW, ECOMMERCE) is a strong plus
Able to translate data insights into strategic business advice
Strong communicator with the ability to tell clear stories with data
Comfortable managing internal and external stakeholders
Thrives in a fast-paced Agile environment
Knowledge or interest in DIY/retail sector is a plus
French or Dutch is a plus
A key role in the digital transformation of a leading Benelux retailer
Work with modern technologies and cloud tools
Hybrid working with flexibility and autonomy
Join an ambitious team making a real impact on millions of customers

📍 Brussels, Belgium - Hybrid (2 days in-office, 3 days remote)

Make real impact with data in the world of DIY &
column2:
retail
For a leading company in the DIY and home improvement retail sector in the Benelux, we are looking for an experienced Senior or Mid-level Data Scientist. With millions of customers across Belgium, the Netherlands, and Luxembourg, this organization helps people build, improve, and personalize their homes.

As they move through a major data-driven transformation, they are seeking a data expert who can turn complex data into real business value through insights and AI-powered solutions.

What you'll do

  • Turn data into business impact: Work closely with Marketing, Operations, Finance, and other departments to solve challenges using data and AI

  • Build end-to-end solutions: Develop and deploy machine learning models and optimize processes from A to Z

  • Work with big data: Analyze large and complex datasets from retail stores, e-commerce platforms, and supply chain systems

  • Collaborate with stakeholders: Work alongside data engineers, product owners, and external partners to deliver scalable, high-quality solutions

  • Translate data into insights: Communicate complex findings in a clear, actionable way to non-technical stakeholders

  • Stay ahead of the curve: Keep up with the latest developments in AI, machine learning, and cloud technology

  • Operate in an agile environment: Use Agile/Kanban methods to prioritize and deliver value efficiently

Who we're looking for



Technical skills

  • Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery), Databricks, Python, and PySpark

  • Skilled in Power BI for dashboarding and reporting

  • Experience building and deploying machine learning models

  • Familiarity with retail, e-commerce, or supply chain datasets

  • Experience with end-to-end data pipelines and putting ML models into production

  • Experience with SAP systems (CAR, BW, ECOMMERCE) is a strong plus

Business &
column3:
soft skills

  • Able to translate data insights into strategic business advice

  • Strong communicator with the ability to tell clear stories with data

  • Comfortable managing internal and external stakeholders

  • Thrives in a fast-paced Agile environment

  • Knowledge or interest in DIY/retail sector is a plus

Language requirements

  • English is required

  • French or Dutch is a plus

What's in it for you

  • A key role in the digital transformation of a leading Benelux retailer

  • Work with modern technologies and cloud tools

  • Hybrid working with flexibility and autonomy

  • Join an ambitious team making a real impact on millions of customers

We zijn namelijk op zoek naar jonge krachten om in september te starten op ons Young Potentials programma.

Zin om als Data scientist fraudedetectie systemen en modellen vorm te geven, onder meer bij de Vlaamse overheid? Passie om AI systemen te engineeren? Heb je expertise om bvb Machine learning toe te passen? Dan raden we je aan om meer over onze projecten te lezen op onze website.

Als AI/ML data engineer verwerk je grote datasets uit een verscheidenheid van bronnen. Ook zorg je ervoor dat er analyses kunnen plaatsvinden en draai je alvast eerste algoritmes om inzichten te verschaffen in de data.

Als data scientist hou je van complexiteit en ben je in staat om data te extraheren en te analyseren. Je focust je op het maken van modellen. Je beschikt over verschillende vaardigheden waaronder statistiek en uiteraard doorgedreven analytics skills.
Als Full stack (Big) Data consultant beheers je beide facetten en ben je een topper in je vakgebied, dit is ook wat we binnen het Vectr ecoysteem nastreven.
gebruikt je analytische denkvermogen om modellen vorm te geven?
bent bedreven in Python? of Spark? of Scala?
hebt (beginnende) expertise als data engineer of data scientist, en dit op moderne Data platformen zoals Databricks?
weet je weg op Cloudplatformen zoals GCP of Azure?
Maar bovenal heb je passie om jouw expertise met innovatieve data technologieën naar verschillende sectoren en klanten te brengen?
Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

4152720443,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-cream-consulting-4152720443?position=24&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=kyRQuYrqDaoQJM%2FEnWuYbA%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Cream Consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Permanent position only

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.
You gather business requirements to better understand your client’s needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client’s needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?
You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)…
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java …
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English
column2: a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset

Sibling is looking for a Data Scientist for a leading insurer in Brussels, Belgium. This will be a long-term freelance assignment.


Role


  • Designing, developing, and implementing AI/data-driven solutions tailored to business needs using internal and external data.
  • Extracting and communicating actionable insights to support decision-making and problem-solving.
  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to identify and address data-related challenges.
  • Continuously monitoring model accuracy and proactively identifying and fixing issues or data drifts.


Skills


  • At least 5 years of experience in data analysis, ideally within a commercial/business context.
  • Hands-on expertise in AI, GenAI, computer vision, NLP, and/or deep learning.
  • Advanced skills in Python, SQL, Power BI, and Databricks.
  • Excellent communication skills – you can clearly present complex data to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Fluency in French or Dutch, and English.
  • Hybrid Working

4188003756,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-ii-agriculture-analytics-machine-learning-geospatial-at-mckinsey-company-4188003756?position=28&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=Fk%2F%2B%2ByYRceH4WjMmO1UrpQ%3D%3D,Data Scientist II - Agriculture Analytics (Machine Learning / Geospatial),McKinsey & Company,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Who You'll Work With
You’ll work with McKinsey’s agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics – generally predictive or geospatial in nature – to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact – redefining what it means to provide the “best of the firm” to our clients.

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE’s core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients’ most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call “IP development”) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.
We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure
column2: highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through

column1: Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred

4189394862,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/manager-data-scientist-at-kpmg-belgium-4189394862?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=pQMsBw%2FbF1yQi4hZhhoUMA%3D%3D,Manager Data Scientist,KPMG Belgium,"Zaventem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Function
A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and background.
Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.
The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!
Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:
Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.

Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Knowledge of dutch is a big plus

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.
Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…

column2:
Responsibilities

  • A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
  • An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and background.
  • Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
  • Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
  • A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.



#technology

Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills &
column3:
Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:

  • Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
  • A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
  • Other types of eduction are also valued.
  • A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
  • Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
  • Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
  • The desire to learn and grow
  • A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
  • Knowledge of dutch is a big plus

We offer

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.

What is the job about?

  • Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
  • Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
  • Mentoring colleagues
  • Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions
  • Gathering and organizing data
  • Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
  • Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
  • Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist IT profiles
  • Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…

Development, maintenance and documentation software, mostly in python, with a focus on implementing and testing data analytics applications, data engineering and data collection tools.

Participate in data science projects led by ECAT scientific staff, and assume responsibility for software engineering tasks, including among others, requirement analysis, software development testing and documentation.
Participation in project update and review meetings and other meetings with project stakeholders.
Level 6 of the European Qualification Framework which typically corresponds to a bachelor degree of 3 years.
Excellent software development skills, in particular, experience implementing python libraries, software and services.

Demonstrated experience in implementing best practices for software testing, from unit and component testing to user acceptance, including negative testing and stress tests, to ensure software quality and reliability.
Experience deploying software tools and services, including definition of APIs, using DevOps tools and practices, CI/CD practices, e.g. in Gitlab or similar environments.

Experience in debugging complex software in python, and troubleshooting aspects related to the deployment of software, such as setting up execution environments, resolving dependencies, installing drivers, analysing networking aspects and using GPU hardware.
Experience in containerization and orchestration technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes or equivalent for the deployment and scaling of data science applications.
Ability and willingness to stay up to date with technologies and libraries for machine learning and data science.
Ability to write clear technical documentation of software for users and other developers, in English language.
Ability to understand, speak and write English (C1)
Ability to design and implement robust data pipelines for the ingestion, cleaning, transformation and
Strong experience in testing software, including frameworks for defining and automating software tests, including regression testing and negative testing.

Job Description

Tasks

  • Development, maintenance and documentation software, mostly in python, with a focus on implementing and testing data analytics applications, data engineering and data collection tools.
  • Participate in data science projects led by ECAT scientific staff, and assume responsibility for software engineering tasks, including among others, requirement analysis, software development testing and documentation.
  • Participation in project update and review meetings and other meetings with project stakeholders.

Level of Education

  • Level 6 of the European Qualification Framework which typically corresponds to a bachelor degree of 3 years.

Knowledge And Skills

  • Excellent software development skills, in particular, experience implementing python libraries, software and services.
  • Demonstrated experience in implementing best practices for software testing, from unit and component testing to user acceptance, including negative testing and stress tests, to ensure software quality and reliability.
  • Experience deploying software tools and services, including definition of APIs, using DevOps tools and practices, CI/CD practices, e.g. in Gitlab or similar environments.
  • Experience in debugging complex software in python, and troubleshooting aspects related to the deployment of software, such as setting up execution environments, resolving dependencies, installing drivers, analysing networking aspects and using GPU hardware.
  • Experience in containerization and orchestration technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes or equivalent for the deployment and scaling of data science applications.
  • Ability and willingness to stay up to date with technologies and libraries for machine learning and data science.
  • Ability to write clear technical documentation of software for users and other developers, in English language.
  • Ability to understand, speak and write English (C1)

Specific Expertise

  • Ability to design and implement robust data pipelines for the ingestion, cleaning, transformation and
  • storage of diverse data sources.
  • Strong experience in testing software, including frameworks for defining and automating software tests, including regression testing and negative testing.

Languages

  • French
  • English

Hiring Team Member

Pulaparthi Yamini Priya

Talent Acquisition Specialist

  • Mail

4195702404,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/applied-research-scientist-at-scipro-4195702404?position=32&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=qusA3aGahMc0MDfD1o0oUA%3D%3D,Applied Research Scientist,SciPro,European Union,"I partner with an AI-driven startup developing a universal foundation model to transform and accelerate drug discovery and biomedical research. They are seeking an Applied Research Scientist, with a strong foundation in Computational Biology (10+ years), including 5+ years in translational science and AI-driven biomarker development.

This role sits at the intersection of AI-driven biopharma R&D and product, making it ideal for someone who can bridge the gap between research and commercial teams. You’ll need to be highly technical while capable of engaging with business stakeholders across pharma and biotech, translating complex scientific challenges into AI-driven solutions that drive real-world impact.

Translate pharma challenges into AI-driven solutions, unlocking insights across target discovery, biomarker development & clinical trial design and collaborating closely with product to align key features with industry needs.
Be the scientific expert during pre and technical sales, enabling trusted knowledge sharing through proof-of-concept studies, domain-specific queries, and compelling presentations.
Guide and educate pharma, biotech and healthcare partners on how to leverage foundation models and extract meaningful insights from multi-modal data.
Represent us at top conferences & industry events, establishing thought leadership in AI-driven drug discovery.
Work closely with the research team to explore and integrate emerging AI and foundation model methodologies into our product.

Deep knowledge of biopharma processes and their challenges, from target discovery to clinical trial design and biomarker development. Able to translate complex R&D needs into actionable AI solutions. Big Pharma experience would be a plus.
Extensive hands-on experience with Computational Biology
column2: genomics, proteomics, and histology data—covering everything from data curation to applying machine learning for scientific discovery. Strong publication record in leading journals or top AI/biology conferences.

column1: Strategic thinker and skilled at engaging both technical and business audiences, delivering insights that drive decision-making.
PhD (or equivalent) in Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, or a related field, with a proven track record in AI-driven biopharma innovation.
Desirable: Entrepreneurship mindset and innovative start-up environment ready.
To learn more about how you can advance and shape the future of Biology and AI apply below or reach out to me directly on i.shirley@sciproglobal.com or 020 3744 4313
This is a full time permanent role, remote (UK/EU) or Hybrid in Paris.

4195448177,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-ml-at-red-global-4195448177?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=gLswmlkZf81RCDp63zkdNg%3D%3D,Data Scientist - ML,RED Global,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","RED Global is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist - ML for our client, a global organisation who are scaling up their data capability. They are looking to bring on board an experienced Data Scientist with experience of Machine Learning, GenAI and solution architecture and software engineering.
Responsible to support and advice various clients to identify and define problems and resolve these complex issues for the business.
You will interact with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages and work with ETL Prosses.
Use AI techniques such as GenAI, supervised and un-supervised machine learning techniques.
Work across the latest data science platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks (e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn).
Support with building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) including Cloud provisioning tools (e.g., Terraform).
Advising to the business stakeholders on data driven marketing - working closely with third parties and, internally, with digital teams, IT, and others.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and French/Dutch with good senior-level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.
3-5 years experiences as a Data Scientist working within global organisations.
Extensive work experience of various Data Science Platforms such as Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn.
Experience building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Must have technical knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) or GenAI.
Industry skills: Manufacturing or Life sciences would be a plus.
Strong analytical skills and appreciation of coding languages, data sources, data matching and data acquisition.

RED Global is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist - ML for our client, a global organisation who are scaling up their data capability. They are looking to bring on board an experienced Data Scientist with experience of Machine Learning, GenAI and solution architecture and software engineering.



Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible to support and advice various clients to identify and define problems and resolve these complex issues for the business.
  • You will interact with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages and work with ETL Prosses.
  • Use AI techniques such as GenAI, supervised and un-supervised machine learning techniques.
  • Work across the latest data science platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks (e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn).
  • Support with building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) including Cloud provisioning tools (e.g., Terraform).
  • Advising to the business stakeholders on data driven marketing - working closely with third parties and, internally, with digital teams, IT, and others.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and French/Dutch with good senior-level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.


Required skills:

  • 3-5 years experiences as a Data Scientist working within global organisations.
  • Extensive work experience of various Data Science Platforms such as Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn.
  • Experience building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
  • Must have technical knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) or GenAI.
  • Industry skills: Manufacturing or Life sciences would be a plus.
  • Strong analytical skills and appreciation of coding languages, data sources, data matching and data acquisition.

4143434522,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-science-manager-at-kpmg-belgium-4143434522?position=34&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=7XKZiCJiy%2BGPSRAlmJJGQQ%3D%3D,Data Science Manager,KPMG Belgium,"Zaventem, Flemish Region, Belgium","Function

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.
Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions Gathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…
The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!
Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:
Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.

Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch or French is required.
As a Certified Top Employer We Offer
An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.

A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,…) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and backgrounds.

column2:
Responsibilities

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.

4198017934,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-v-m-x-at-national-bank-of-belgium-4198017934?position=35&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=TVC%2FnRD04Mw3gS4a7p30iw%3D%3D,Data Scientist (V/M/X),National Bank of Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Het Data Science Center (DSC) is een dynamisch team binnen het Data & Analytics Office (GO) dat zich inzet om de producten en diensten van NBB te verbeteren met behulp van geavanceerde data science technieken. Het DSC fungeert als een center of expertise, bestaande uit 10 collega's met diepgaande kennis in verschillende data science domeinen. Het DSC stelt zijn expertise ter beschikking van heel de NBB en werkt waar mogelijk samen met andere centrale banken, waardoor zowel de gebruikte technologieën als de toepassingsdomeinen zeer gevarieerd zijn en continu evolueren.
Werken in het DSC betekent continu je data science expertise up-to-date houden, en deze inzetten om bij te dragen aan de missies van NBB.

je blijft op de hoogte van de ontwikkelingen binnen data science, in het bijzonder van de mogelijkheden en de beperkingen van kwantitatieve methodes (tijdsreeksanalyse, AI, machine learning, statistiek, wiskunde,…)
je bent bereid je voortdurend bij te scholen in deze technieken, je hebt inzicht in de technieken en legt de voor- en/of nadelen ervan uit aan je collega's

je onderzoekt en werkt mee aan concrete problemen binnen verschillenden entiteiten van de Bank, je geeft coaching aan collega's en je probeert generieke componenten voor transversaal gebruik te detecteren en te implementeren
je documenteert de oplossingen en moedigt het gebruik van de transversale componenten aan bij andere entiteiten van de Bank, bv door het geven van opleidingen in de context van de Data Academy
je zorgt ervoor dat de uitgewerkte oplossingen correct worden uitgevoerd via coaching of opleiding
je houdt hierbij rekening met de Enterprise Data Management (EDM) principes, licht die - zo nodig - toe aan de collega's en past ze toe
je zoekt samen met de collega's op een creatieve en innovatieve manier naar oplossingen voor de gestelde problemen
je zorgt voor een optimale kennisdeling rond data science binnen NBB, onder andere door inhoudelijk en organisationeel bij te dragen aan de goede werking van de NBB data science community
je netwerkt met mogelijke academische partners en andere centrale banken
je hebt een sterke achtergrond in statistiek, wiskunde en computerwetenschappen, aangevuld met de nodige relevante ervaring voor deze functie
je beschikt over een goede kennis van tijdsreeksanalyse, of bent bereid je hierin te verdiepen
je beschikt over een goede kennis van generatieve AI, of bent bereid je hierin te verdiepen
je beschikt over didactische vaardigheden om het waarom en hoe van de gebruikte (vaak complexe) technieken uit te leggen aangepast aan het kennisniveau van de doelgroep
je hebt een goede kennis van Python of R
kennis van de volgende technologieën zijn een pluspunt: de beschikbare data science componenten in Azure, Databricks, MLOps
wiskundige technieken (statistiek, algoritmes, machine learning, ...) gebruiken en uitleggen schrikt je niet af
je beschikt over de nodige kennis om oplossingen te ontwikkelen die aan de vereisten van informaticaveiligheid en vertrouwelijkheid van gegevens voldoen
je bent nieuwsgierig en gepassioneerd om innoverende oplossingen te ontwikkelen in een omgeving die voortdurend verandert.
je houdt graag je kennis up to date en schoolt jezelf graag bij in verschillende data science domeinen
je kunt zowel in een multidisciplinair team als zelfstandig werken
je bent houder van een master in de informatica, ingenieurswetenschappen, fysica, wiskunde, statistiek, handelsingenieur of je hebt een gelijkwaardige ervaring
je hebt een goede kennis van het Nederlands, Frans en het Engels (niveau B1)

Een aantrekkelijk loon en tal van bovenwettelijke voordelen (groepsverzekering, uitgebreide hospitalisatieverzekering, iPhone met abonnement...) en een goed evenwicht tussen werk- en privéleven evenals de mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk

Een echte carrière: de NBB biedt je de mogelijkheid om je voortdurend te blijven ontwikkelen. We bieden je een breed scala aan opleidingen om de vaardigheden te verwerven die je nodig hebt om je carrière verder uit te bouwen
Een unieke job, waar we onze kennis en expertise ten dienste stellen van de maatschappij
Een plek waar je initiatief kan nemen en wordt aangemoedigd om te laten zien wat je kunt
Een fijne, collegiale en dynamische werksfeer

Aandacht voor je welzijn: om ervoor te zorgen dat je je goed voelt op de werkvloer en thuis, biedt de NBB een ruim aanbod aan sportactiviteiten (fitnessruimte, groepslessen…), culturele activiteiten en inspirerende workshops.

Alleen de kandidaturen die vergezeld gaan van een motivatiebrief, een CV en een kopie van het/de diploma('s), komen in aanmerking. Buitenlandse diploma's zijn enkel geldig in combinatie met een gelijkwaardigheidsattest.
Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

  • je zorgt ervoor dat de uitgewerkte oplossingen correct worden uitgevoerd via coaching of opleiding
  • je houdt hierbij rekening met de Enterprise Data Management (EDM) principes, licht die - zo nodig - toe aan de collega's en past ze toe
  • je zoekt samen met de collega's op een creatieve en innovatieve manier naar oplossingen voor de gestelde problemen
  • je zorgt voor een optimale kennisdeling rond data science binnen NBB, onder andere door inhoudelijk en organisationeel bij te dragen aan de goede werking van de NBB data science community
  • je netwerkt met mogelijke academische partners en andere centrale banken
  • je hebt een sterke achtergrond in statistiek, wiskunde en computerwetenschappen, aangevuld met de nodige relevante ervaring voor deze functie
  • je beschikt over een goede kennis van tijdsreeksanalyse, of bent bereid je hierin te verdiepen
  • je beschikt over een goede kennis van generatieve AI, of bent bereid je hierin te verdiepen
  • je beschikt over didactische vaardigheden om het waarom en hoe van de gebruikte (vaak complexe) technieken uit te leggen aangepast aan het kennisniveau van de doelgroep
  • je hebt een goede kennis van Python of R
  • kennis van de volgende technologieën zijn een pluspunt: de beschikbare data science componenten in Azure, Databricks, MLOps
  • wiskundige technieken (statistiek, algoritmes, machine learning, ...) gebruiken en uitleggen schrikt je niet af
  • je beschikt over de nodige kennis om oplossingen te ontwikkelen die aan de vereisten van informaticaveiligheid en vertrouwelijkheid van gegevens voldoen
  • je bent nieuwsgierig en gepassioneerd om innoverende oplossingen te ontwikkelen in een omgeving die voortdurend verandert.
  • je houdt graag je kennis up to date en schoolt jezelf graag bij in verschillende data science domeinen
  • je kunt zowel in een multidisciplinair team als zelfstandig werken
  • je bent houder van een master in de informatica, ingenieurswetenschappen, fysica, wiskunde, statistiek, handelsingenieur of je hebt een gelijkwaardige ervaring
  • je hebt een goede kennis van het Nederlands, Frans en het Engels (niveau B1)
  • Een aantrekkelijk loon en tal van bovenwettelijke voordelen (groepsverzekering, uitgebreide hospitalisatieverzekering, iPhone met abonnement...) en een goed evenwicht tussen werk- en privéleven evenals de mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk
  • Een echte carrière: de NBB biedt je de mogelijkheid om je voortdurend te blijven ontwikkelen. We bieden je een breed scala aan opleidingen om de vaardigheden te verwerven die je nodig hebt om je carrière verder uit te bouwen
  • Een unieke job, waar we onze kennis en expertise ten dienste stellen van de maatschappij
  • Een plek waar je initiatief kan nemen en wordt aangemoedigd om te laten zien wat je kunt
  • Een fijne, collegiale en dynamische werksfeer
  • Aandacht voor je welzijn: om ervoor te zorgen dat je je goed voelt op de werkvloer en thuis, biedt de NBB een ruim aanbod aan sportactiviteiten (fitnessruimte, groepslessen…), culturele activiteiten en inspirerende workshops.

Alleen de kandidaturen die vergezeld gaan van een motivatiebrief, een CV en een kopie van het/de diploma('s), komen in aanmerking. Buitenlandse diploma's zijn enkel geldig in combinatie met een gelijkwaardigheidsattest.

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

4158243246,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/research-scientist-jr-at-qplox-engineering-4158243246?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=c70oSD98y1B2E10lSYr92Q%3D%3D,Research Scientist (Jr),Qplox engineering,"Leuven, Flemish Region, Belgium","Position: Jr. Research Scientist
We seek a motivated Junior Research Scientist with a PhD (up to 2 years post-PhD) in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, or Operational Research.
Develop novel methods and algorithms customized for solving network optimization problems involving nonlinear coupling constraints, nonconvex/nonlinear composite objective functions, etc.
Integrate them as part of product-grade solver framework for automated execution.
Network optimization including network design, network embedding, routing/traffic assignment, resource allocation, flow/resource scheduling, etc.

Optimization Expertise: Mixed-integer nonlinear programming (mandatory) and iterative methods like quasi-Newton, primal-dual methods (Lagrangian methods, etc.), interior point, combinatorial methods: polyhedral methods, etc.
Programming: Proficiency in C/C++, Fortran, and Octave.
Tools: Good knowledge of MI(N)LP solving frameworks such as Gurobi, SCIP, Couenne/COIN-OR, SHOT/COIN-OR, Bonmin, etc. and subsolvers (e.g. MIP: CPlex, NLP: Ipopt, Conopt, Algencan).
Attention to detail, adaptability, teamwork, and responsiveness.
Programming: Outstanding programming skills (experimental code or ICPC winner) in C/C++ and Octave programming (programming skills in FORTRAN is considered as a plus)

Expertise in network optimization methods and algorithms: list of achievements and publications (Springer: JOTA, COAP, AMO, JGO, NUMA, etc. Wiley: Networks, IEEE JSAC, IEEE Transactions on Communications, etc.) –note: theoretical knowledge of abstract algorithms not sufficient

Position: Jr. Research Scientist

Location: Brussels/Leuven, Belgium


Role Overview

We seek a motivated Junior Research Scientist with a PhD (up to 2 years post-PhD) in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, or Operational Research.


Your Responsibilities

  • Develop novel methods and algorithms customized for solving network optimization problems involving nonlinear coupling constraints, nonconvex/nonlinear composite objective functions, etc.
  • Validate (numerically/experimentally) solutions using real-life datasets.
  • Integrate them as part of product-grade solver framework for automated execution.


Required Skills

  • Network optimization including network design, network embedding, routing/traffic assignment, resource allocation, flow/resource scheduling, etc.
  • Optimization Expertise: Mixed-integer nonlinear programming (mandatory) and iterative methods like quasi-Newton, primal-dual methods (Lagrangian methods, etc.), interior point, combinatorial methods: polyhedral methods, etc.
  • Programming: Proficiency in C/C++, Fortran, and Octave.
  • Tools: Good knowledge of MI(N)LP solving frameworks such as Gurobi, SCIP, Couenne/COIN-OR, SHOT/COIN-OR, Bonmin, etc. and subsolvers (e.g. MIP: CPlex, NLP: Ipopt, Conopt, Algencan).


Soft Skills

  • Attention to detail, adaptability, teamwork, and responsiveness.


Application Requirements

  • CV highlighting:
  • Programming: Outstanding programming skills (experimental code or ICPC winner) in C/C++ and Octave programming (programming skills in FORTRAN is considered as a plus)
  • Expertise in network optimization methods and algorithms: list of achievements and publications (Springer: JOTA, COAP, AMO, JGO, NUMA, etc. Wiley: Networks, IEEE JSAC, IEEE Transactions on Communications, etc.) –note: theoretical knowledge of abstract algorithms not sufficient
  • Languages: Proficiency in English (Dutch/Mandarin beneficial).

3899046018,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-h-f-at-littlebigcode-3899046018?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=OpYYaKN9q39Q1VBz7vdqHA%3D%3D,Data Scientist (H/F),LittleBigCode,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment.

For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.
A community of more than 40 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up
As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !
What will be your tasks with us ?
You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and production.
You will be working in the following areas:
Business case study with business teams
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Going into production with Data Engineers
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations
You have a Master in engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Scientist !
You have bases in the realization of POC, the development of models and applications starting from- scratch as well as in the putting into production
You master programming best practices such as code versionning (git), IDE use (PyCharm fore.g.), testing, use of CI/CD tools
You are fully proficient in Python, Machine learning & Deep learning frameworks (Scikit-Learn & Tensorflow for e.g.) and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
You are familiar with some of the following domains: time series, NLP, Computer Vision, reinforcement learning, IoT
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French
