4185021139,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-engineer-f-m-x-at-amaris-consulting-4185021139?position=56&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=bAgk%2B8N%2F5p2270bgQXUWTg%3D%3D,Machine Learning Engineer F/M/X,Amaris Consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
We look forward to meeting you!

Are you a skilled ML Engineer ready for your next adventure? Amaris Consulting is on the lookout for a motivated individual with a strong background in machine learning to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Brussels. This is a great opportunity for professionals with keen analytical abilities, a strong technical sense, and excellent communication skills.
Design, build, and train machine learning models to address complex business problems.
Fine-tune model performance through feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and validation techniques.
Develop pipelines to deploy machine learning models into production, ensuring reliability and scalability.
Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders to align model outcomes with strategic goals.
Stay up to date with emerging ML techniques and tools, contributing to continuous improvement initiatives.

We are seeking a candidate with a strong background in machine learning and excellent problem-solving skills. Your attention to detail and ability to simplify complex information will set you apart. You thrive in collaborative environments but can also work independently when needed.
Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
Understanding of statistical methods, data processing, and model evaluation techniques.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
Experience with cloud-based ML platforms (AWS SageMaker, Google AI Platform, Azure ML).
Proven track record in deploying machine learning models at scale.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.
💡 We are an independent company that values:
Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.

Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Understanding the client’s needs and the Agent's requirements gathered by your Tech Lead.
Investigate and validate the most relevant Generative AI model with your team to answer the need.
Identifying and collecting the dataset and preprocessing the data.
Developing the RAG to access relevant documentation and fetch it to your Generative AI model.
Developing the POC of the Agent, including the backend, the frontend, the API and the database.
The opportunity to acquire unique expertise in every aspect of AI Agents.
A diverse and dynamic work environment - you'll be surrounded by peers and enthusiasts who share your passion for technology.
The chance to get involved in Hackathons, Code Challenges and Lab Camps organized by Zest Reply or our Group.

A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, or a Technology-related field.
Fluent in English as well as either French or Dutch.
Clean code practices in Python, preferably with Langchain or Langgraph.
The ability to investigate and perform research independently and an agile mindset to develop POCs.
A knowledge of Power Plaform, Neo4J and Typescript is appreciated.

Zest Reply, part of the Reply Group, is a leader in Generative AI solutions, focusing on enhancing customer engagement, compliance automation, and AI-powered software development. We collaborate with global clients across finance, telecommunications, and retail sectors, providing innovative solutions to modern business challenges. Zest Reply combines deep AI expertise with a culture of innovation and collaboration, driving cutting-edge solutions that deliver real value.

Junior Generative AI Developer


Tasks


  • Understanding the client’s needs and the Agent's requirements gathered by your Tech Lead.
  • Investigate and validate the most relevant Generative AI model with your team to answer the need.
  • Identifying and collecting the dataset and preprocessing the data.
  • Developing the RAG to access relevant documentation and fetch it to your Generative AI model.
  • Developing the POC of the Agent, including the backend, the frontend, the API and the database.


Benefits


  • The opportunity to acquire unique expertise in every aspect of AI Agents.
  • A diverse and dynamic work environment - you'll be surrounded by peers and enthusiasts who share your passion for technology.
  • The chance to get involved in Hackathons, Code Challenges and Lab Camps organized by Zest Reply or our Group.
  • A structured career progression toward more technological and managerial responsibilities.
  • A competitive salary with a leasing vehicle or a mobility package.


Qualifications


  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, or a Technology-related field.
  • Fluent in English as well as either French or Dutch.
  • Clean code practices in Python, preferably with Langchain or Langgraph.
  • The ability to investigate and perform research independently and an agile mindset to develop POCs.
  • A knowledge of Power Plaform, Neo4J and Typescript is appreciated.


About Zest Reply

Zest Reply, part of the Reply Group, is a leader in Generative AI solutions, focusing on enhancing customer engagement, compliance automation, and AI-powered software development. We collaborate with global clients across finance, telecommunications, and retail sectors, providing innovative solutions to modern business challenges. Zest Reply combines deep AI expertise with a culture of innovation and collaboration, driving cutting-edge solutions that deliver real value.

Expert Data Scientist

Location: Brussels, Belgium (On-site or Remote)

Contract Type: Long-term EU Institution Project

EU Citizenship Required



Job Description

We are hiring an Expert Data Scientist to lead high-level analytics projects for European institutions. You will be responsible for designing AI-driven strategies, handling large-scale datasets, and driving data innovation within a multidisciplinary team.



Requirements

  • Master’s degree in a relevant field
  • Minimum 12 years of experience in ICT, including 6 years in data science
  • Strong expertise in AI, machine learning, deep learning, and statistical modeling
  • Experience with cloud-based data solutions (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud)
  • Any recognized data-related certification is accepted
  • Fluent in English



Offer

  • The opportunity to work on cutting-edge data projects for EU institutions
  • A long-term and stable contract
  • Competitive daily rates



If you meet the above requirements, please send your CV along with your certifications to:

📧 jjahbala@eservicios.indra.es

4206199704,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ml-nlp-engineer-ai-engineer-at-nordhealth-4206199704?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=7IRMb6a2rJphHjo3B6wbDA%3D%3D,ML/NLP Engineer - AI Engineer,Nordhealth,European Economic Area,"👋 Who are we?

Nordhealth’s mission is to build software that improves the daily lives of healthcare professionals. We build software that empowers veterinary and therapy professionals to provide the best possible care experiences to their patients. Our products are used daily by over 50,000 professionals in clinics and hospitals across 30+ countries. We excel with 20+ years of experience in healthcare and veterinary software.

We understand that talent comes from everywhere and anywhere. The greater our diversity, the better the products we deliver. That’s why we are a remote-first company, headquartered in Helsinki, Finland, with all 400+ employees working either remotely or from collaboration hubs. While our market presence is currently strongest in the Nordics, our customer base is rapidly growing in our other markets too, especially in Europe and North America (more at our website nordhealth.com.)

Are you an experienced Engineer who has recently transitioned into A.I and eager to work on meaningful projects with real-world impact? Do you thrive in a flexible, remote-first environment? Join our team at Provet Cloud, where we're developing cutting-edge AI solutions that streamline veterinary workflows and enhance patient care. We are looking for an ML/NLP Engineer to help us build AI-driven tools for patient history summarization, discharge notes, and medical transcriptions.
This is a fully remote role, offering autonomy, collaboration, and the opportunity to work with a global team of professionals who are passionate about AI and its applications in healthcare.

As part of this role, you will also play a key role in shaping our AI group, defining best practices, and paving the way for innovative AI-powered veterinary healthcare solutions. Your expertise will help establish the foundation for how we leverage AI in clinical decision-making, ensuring our models are trustworthy, scalable, and impactful. 🚀
Develop and optimize AI models for extracting clinical insights from veterinary records, including discharge notes, patient history, and transcriptions.
Lead the early development of our AI group, helping define strategies, tools, and methodologies to build a strong AI foundation.
Research and evaluate third-party AI services (e.g., AWS Bedrock, Google Cloud AI, OpenAI) for potential integration into Provet Cloud.
Build proof-of-concepts (POCs) to assess third-party AI services against in-house models, optimizing for performance, scalability, and accuracy.
Deploy AI/NLP solutions using Python, ensuring seamless API integrations with cloud-based systems.
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and veterinary professionals to enhance AI-driven workflows and improve user experience.
Establish AI best practices within the team, helping guide future AI development across Provet Cloud.
What will help you to be successful in this role?
Ideally, you have already gained some experience from working in a fast growing, global SaaS company. Additionally:
1. Strong Foundations in Machine Learning & Deep Learning
Solid understanding of ML/DL algorithms (e.g., supervised/unsupervised learning, transformers, reinforcement learning).
Experience with frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or JAX.
Knowledge of model evaluation, hyperparameter tuning, and optimization techniques.
Familiarity with key NLP techniques such as tokenization, embeddings, attention mechanisms, and sequence modeling.
Experience with transformer models (e.g., BERT, GPT, T5, LLaMA) and fine-tuning large language models (LLMs).
Understanding of multilingual processing, entity recognition, summarization, and sentiment analysis.
Proficiency in Python (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn) and ML libraries.
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and ML pipelines (Kubeflow, MLflow).
Ability to write efficient, scalable, and maintainable code, including CI/CD practices.
Strong ability to clean, preprocess, and augment textual datasets for training robust models.
Experience with large-scale data processing tools (Spark, Dask, Ray).
Knowledge of vector databases and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG).
Staying up to date with state-of-the-art advancements in ML/NLP (e.g., reading arXiv papers, participating in AI conferences).
Ability to experiment with new architectures, loss functions, and fine-tuning techniques.
Strong problem-solving mindset to bridge the gap between research and real-world applications
Ability to explain complex ML/NLP concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working in cross-functional teams with data engineers, product managers, and designers.
Writing clear documentation and sharing insights through reports or presentations.
Strong understanding of Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning (DL) concepts, including supervised/unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, and neural networks.
Expertise in Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques such as tokenization, embeddings, attention mechanisms, and sequence modeling.
Proficiency in transformer-based models (BERT, GPT, T5, LLaMA) and fine-tuning large language models (LLMs).
Solid programming skills in Python (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn) and ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or JAX.
Experience in cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and working with ML pipelines (Kubeflow, MLflow).
Strong data processing skills, including text preprocessing, feature engineering, and large-scale data handling using Spark, Dask, or Ray.
Understanding of MLOps, including model deployment, monitoring, A/B testing, and drift detection.
Knowledge of vector databases, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and fine-tuning pre-trained models for production applications.
Familiarity with bias mitigation, ethical AI principles, and regulatory frameworks (GDPR, CCPA).
Strong problem-solving mindset, ability to innovate, and continuously learn new advancements in AI.
Proven experience (2 + years) in ML/NLP model development, training, and deployment.
Hands-on experience with fine-tuning and optimizing transformer-based NLP models for real-world applications.
Experience in building, deploying, and scaling ML/NLP models in production environments.
Previous work with large-scale datasets and big data processing frameworks.
Experience in cross-functional collaboration, working with data engineers, product managers, and research teams.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with the ability to design, implement, and evaluate complex AI solutions.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, capable of explaining AI concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, agile environment, balancing multiple projects while ensuring high-quality deliverables.
Passion for AI innovation, staying updated on state-of-the-art advancements, and applying research to practical applications.

At Nordhealth, we do things a little bit differently. We value continuous improvement, diverse teams and autonomy which drive our collaboration. Our global healthcare domain is rapidly developing and we are seeking colleagues who enjoy working in this type of environment. 🌎
The chance to work in a meaningful industry and in a fast-growing, global company on a path to changing digital healthcare
The tools you need, and enjoy using
Frequent company events and talented colleagues from around the world

If you enjoy working in a fast-growing and international environment with the possibility to make an impact, this might be the perfect job for you. Apply now! We'll fill the position as soon as we find the right person.

  • Solid programming skills in Python (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn) and ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or JAX.
  • Experience in cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and working with ML pipelines (Kubeflow, MLflow).
  • Strong data processing skills, including text preprocessing, feature engineering, and large-scale data handling using Spark, Dask, or Ray.
  • Understanding of MLOps, including model deployment, monitoring, A/B testing, and drift detection.
  • Knowledge of vector databases, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and fine-tuning pre-trained models for production applications.
  • Familiarity with bias mitigation, ethical AI principles, and regulatory frameworks (GDPR, CCPA).
  • Strong problem-solving mindset, ability to innovate, and continuously learn new advancements in AI.


Experience:

  • Proven experience (2 + years) in ML/NLP model development, training, and deployment.
  • Hands-on experience with fine-tuning and optimizing transformer-based NLP models for real-world applications.
  • Experience in building, deploying, and scaling ML/NLP models in production environments.
  • Previous work with large-scale datasets and big data processing frameworks.
  • Experience in cross-functional collaboration, working with data engineers, product managers, and research teams.


Capabilities:

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with the ability to design, implement, and evaluate complex AI solutions.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, capable of explaining AI concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, agile environment, balancing multiple projects while ensuring high-quality deliverables.
  • Passion for AI innovation, staying updated on state-of-the-art advancements, and applying research to practical applications.


What’s in it for you?

At Nordhealth, we do things a little bit differently. We value continuous improvement, diverse teams and autonomy which drive our collaboration. Our global healthcare domain is rapidly developing and we are seeking colleagues who enjoy working in this type of environment. 🌎


In addition, we offer:

  • The chance to work in a meaningful industry and in a fast-growing, global company on a path to changing digital healthcare
  • Competitive compensation and benefits
  • Learning and professional growth opportunities
  • The tools you need, and enjoy using
  • Frequent company events and talented colleagues from around the world


If you enjoy working in a fast-growing and international environment with the possibility to make an impact, this might be the perfect job for you. Apply now! We'll fill the position as soon as we find the right person.

4193416236,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-sword-group-4193416236?position=60&pageNum=0&refId=Y30rFCltx%2FywkikGJVuEmw%3D%3D&trackingId=x%2FMKUvF6cjEotfuJ92c9Tg%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Sword Group,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Job Description

Voor een organisatie actief binnen het culturele en vrijetijdsdomein zoeken wij een Data Scientist die wil meewerken aan innovatieve datagedreven toepassingen met maatschappelijke meerwaarde. De opdracht maakt deel uit van een raamovereenkomst die ruimte biedt voor langdurige samenwerking op strategische en operationele dataprojecten.
De ontwikkeling, optimalisatie en het onderhoud van bestaande en nieuwe datamodellen
Het opzetten van descriptieve en predictieve analyses met impact op B2B- en B2C-toepassingen
De toepassing van machine learning en AI-technieken binnen een breed data-ecosysteem
De begeleiding van dataproducten binnen een Data Mesh architectuur
Het bijdragen aan een Europees gesubsidieerd project met focus op linked open data, gebruikscontrole en publieksontwikkeling
Het mee uittekenen van een visie en strategie rond data en AI binnen een organisatie met een sociale missie.

De data-infrastructuur is opgebouwd op Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Cloud Composer, DBT, Airflow, etc.) en maakt gebruik van Python en Jupyter Notebooks. Andere technologieën: Kubernetes, Looker Studio, ClickHouse, Jena Fuseki, GitHub Actions, Docker.
Masterdiploma of gelijkwaardige ervaring in een datagedreven domein
Ervaring met supervised/unsupervised learning, deep learning, NLP, anomaly detection, recommendation engines
Grondige kennis van Python, R of Java
Ervaring met open-source ML/AI libraries en cloud-native tools
Pluspunt: ervaring met Data Mesh architectuur en linked open data.
Teamspeler die graag samenwerkt met data engineers, analisten en productmanagers
Je kan de leefwereld van eindgebruikers vatten en houdt van maatschappelijke impact
Je bent proactief, leergierig en kan werken met deadlines.
Waarom dit project interessant is voor jou
Kans om te werken aan maatschappelijk relevante projecten binnen vrije tijd, cultuur en participatie
Deelname aan het EFRO-project “Data Spaces, Audience Data” (2025–2026), in samenwerking met overheden en andere partners
Flexibele inzet via minicompetities binnen een raamovereenkomst van minimaal 2 jaar, verlengbaar tot 4 jaar.

4204357624,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-engineer-at-orange-4204357624?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=ROaTPwXFaU5qi2NADeC6GA%3D%3D&trackingId=U5qoDNRyH1PU0JT2p13MOA%3D%3D,Machine Learning Engineer,Orange,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","As a collaborator in the Machine Learning team, you ensure the different predictive models and algorithms are running qualitatively and on time in the production environment also called the model factory. The mission of the machine learning engineer is key because this role makes the bridge between the products delivered by the Data Science team and the usage of the business.
The machine learning engineer will also cover some more technical missions as for example web scraping, POC’s concerning AI & Generative AI (in order to ensure a move to production for those POC’s).
The Machine Learning team is responsible for the quality of the models and as a consequence of the value created by the models that will be used by all the internal clients.
Deploy large scale machine learning models and other scripts into production environment (in cloud and on-premise environments)
Review, optimize and simplify the code to ensure quality and reusability
Monitor the quality of input variables and the performances of the models’ outputs.
Contribute to parts of the ML pipeline, such as data preprocessing, feature selection, and model evaluation.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and product teams to integrate models into production.
Monitor model performance and updates models as needed
Solve well-defined machine learning problems and may work on smaller projects or parts of larger projects.
Apply existing algorithms and techniques to specific business problems
Expert understanding of git, experience with CI/CD pipelines
Proficiency at Python and solid knowledge of at least one deep learning framework such as TensorFlow / Keras or PyTorch is a must.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques, general deep learning, predictive modelling and Generative AI in order to be able to challenge the inputs and the outputs produced by the Data Science team
Understanding of Google Cloud Platform, ML Ops principles and software development tools/best practices
Expertise in Data Ingestion / Processing and Modelling: you are able to express complex data needs and understand data quality-cleansing processes & methods
Extensive Corporate Data Knowledge: aware of critical company business processes and underlying data, you are able to challenge data quality
Fluency in SQL for writing efficient queries on large datasets
Good knowledge of Linux operating system
Ability to write robust code in Python, R and Java
Good to have: good knowledge of networking, multiprocessing, parallel computing and real-time computations
Should be able to challenge the inputs and outputs of AI and Gen AI products as well as the way it was built.
Master's degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics) or equivalent work experience. with 2-5 years of experience in machine learning or related fields
Proficient in key machine learning tools and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Strong programming and data analytics skills
Able to work and collaborate transversally
Collaboration skills (with other data scientists, data engineers and other teams)
Capacity to influence and engage, assertiveness and being diplomatic
Fluent English and fluent French or Dutch

You will make the difference in this highly innovative vibe. As a result, you will develop your full potential by working with highly skilled colleagues and through continuous training. Moreover, you can count on a highly competitive and versatile compensation (market competitive salary, company car or legal mobility budget, homeworking and net allowance, performance bonus, meal vouchers) and benefits package.
Inspired? Please send us your resume and we will rapidly get back to you to invite you for further interviews.

4149733613,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-fr-at-nmbs-sncb-4149733613?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=ROaTPwXFaU5qi2NADeC6GA%3D%3D&trackingId=CCqp02XbVSz9yG9R8JEpFw%3D%3D,Data Scientist _FR,NMBS-SNCB,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Comment pouvez-vous faire la différence ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist au sein de notre Direction Customer Services, vous jouez un rôle clé dans l’analyse de nos bases de données afin de définir la stratégie commerciale pour le clients B2B et B2C de la SNCB, tant au niveau national qu’international. Vous rejoignez le département Customer Data, responsable de l'analyse des données clients, de l'automatisation du marketing et de la gestion des données clients.
Quel est votre rôle à la SNCB ?

Au sein du département Customer Data, vous serez responsable de l'analyse d'ensembles de données volumineux et complexes, du développement de modèles prédictifs et de la fourniture d'informations qui soutiennent les décisions stratégiques de la SNCB.
Vous développez de nouveaux modèles stratégiques et marketing et améliorer les modèles existants (ex: modèle de prospection pour le segment B2B pour les Account Managers).
Vous analysez et interprétez les données des voyageurs pour fournir des informations stratégiques à certains Head of d’autres départements.
Vous développez des visuels et des rapports dans des outils tels que Power BI pour présenter les résultats de manière claire, syntétique, accessible et convainquante.
Vous effectuez des analyses de données géographiques et spatiales et vous soutenez les analyses de transport.
Vous collaborez de manière transversale au sein de l'entreprise. Vous agissez en tant que conseiller et personne de confiance en matière de données clients.

Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme de master (ou équivalent par expérience) dans une orientation pertinente (par exemple, analyse de données, statistiques, géographie, économie, ingénieur civil, ... ) ET vous disposez ’au moins 3 ans d’expérience comme Data Analyst.
Vous vous reconnaissez dans les compétences suivantes:
Vous maîtrisez les techniques d'analyse mutlivariables et avez de l'expérience dans la gestion et l'analyse de données géographiques.
Vous êtes capable d'utiliser des outils de visualisation et d'analyse de données tels que Power BI et PySpark.
En tant qu’excellent communicateur, vous savez expliquer clairement et efficacement des idées complexes à différents interlocuteurs.
Vous pouvez diriger des projets techniquement complexes et coacher vos collègues pour atteindre les objectifs fixés.
Vous êtes capable de résoudre des problèmes de manière creative et dans la collaboration avec des équipes transversales au sein de la SNCB.
Vous vous adaptez facilement aux besoins du projet et aux attentes des parties prenantes internes.
Vous comprenez une conversation en néerlandais.

Chaque personne est unique. Il est important pour nous que vous puissiez être vous-même. C’est ce qui rend la SNCB plus forte. C’est pourquoi nous accordons beaucoup d’importance à la diversité et à l’inclusion.

En tant que Senior Data Scientist, vous choisissez un job qui a un impact sur la stratégie commerciale de la SNCB. Vous vous trouverez dans un environnement de travail agréable, avec une pertinence sociétale et vous êtes entouré de collègues motivés et sympathiques.
En outre, vous pouvez compter sur :
Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13e mois, d'une indemnité de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, d’une voiture flex, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.
Vous travaillez à Bruxelles dans la Direction Customer Services, à proximité de la gare de Bruxelles-Midi et à domicile. Vous rejoignez l’équipe Customer Data composée de 8 personnes.
Nous analysons votre CV et votre motivation.
Nous vous invitons à un entretien de sélection (en ligne). Afin de préparer cet entretien, nous vous demanderons de compléter un questionnaire de personnalité et un test de raisonnement en ligne.
Dans un second temps, et afin de vous donner une bonne idée de la fonction, nous vous soumettrons un case study éliminatoire.
Si le case study est concluant, un deuxième entretien sera organisé si nécessaire.
Tout se déroule de manière positive ? Nous vous faisons une proposition de contrat.
Vous êtes prêt·e pour votre premier jour de travail !
Sur le contenu de la fonction

Comment pouvez-vous faire la différence ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist au sein de notre Direction Customer Services, vous jouez un rôle clé dans l’analyse de nos bases de données afin de définir la stratégie commerciale pour le clients B2B et B2C de la SNCB, tant au niveau national qu’international. Vous rejoignez le département Customer Data, responsable de l'analyse des données clients, de l'automatisation du marketing et de la gestion des données clients.

Quel est votre rôle à la SNCB ?

Au sein du département Customer Data, vous serez responsable de l'analyse d'ensembles de données volumineux et complexes, du développement de modèles prédictifs et de la fourniture d'informations qui soutiennent les décisions stratégiques de la SNCB.

En tant que Data Scientist:

  • Vous développez de nouveaux modèles stratégiques et marketing et améliorer les modèles existants (ex: modèle de prospection pour le segment B2B pour les Account Managers).
  • Vous analysez et interprétez les données des voyageurs pour fournir des informations stratégiques à certains Head of d’autres départements.
  • Vous développez des visuels et des rapports dans des outils tels que Power BI pour présenter les résultats de manière claire, syntétique, accessible et convainquante.
  • Vous effectuez des analyses de données géographiques et spatiales et vous soutenez les analyses de transport.
  • Vous collaborez de manière transversale au sein de l'entreprise. Vous agissez en tant que conseiller et personne de confiance en matière de données clients.

Un job fait pour vous ?

  • Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme de master (ou équivalent par expérience) dans une orientation pertinente (par exemple, analyse de données, statistiques, géographie, économie, ingénieur civil, ... ) ET vous disposez ’au moins 3 ans d’expérience comme Data Analyst.

Vous vous reconnaissez dans les compétences suivantes:

  • Vous maîtrisez les techniques d'analyse mutlivariables et avez de l'expérience dans la gestion et l'analyse de données géographiques.
  • Vous êtes capable d'utiliser des outils de visualisation et d'analyse de données tels que Power BI et PySpark.
  • En tant qu’excellent communicateur, vous savez expliquer clairement et efficacement des idées complexes à différents interlocuteurs.
  • Vous pouvez diriger des projets techniquement complexes et coacher vos collègues pour atteindre les objectifs fixés.
  • Vous êtes capable de résoudre des problèmes de manière creative et dans la collaboration avec des équipes transversales au sein de la SNCB.
  • Vous vous adaptez facilement aux besoins du projet et aux attentes des parties prenantes internes.
  • Vous comprenez une conversation en néerlandais.

Chaque personne est unique. Il est important pour nous que vous puissiez être vous-même. C’est ce qui rend la SNCB plus forte. C’est pourquoi nous accordons beaucoup d’importance à la diversité et à l’inclusion.

Qu'avons-nous à vous offrir ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist, vous choisissez un job qui a un impact sur la stratégie commerciale de la SNCB. Vous vous trouverez dans un environnement de travail agréable, avec une pertinence sociétale et vous êtes entouré de collègues motivés et sympathiques.

En outre, vous pouvez compter sur :

  • Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13e mois, d'une indemnité de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
  • Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, d’une voiture flex, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
  • Une assurance hospitalisation et collective.
  • Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
  • Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
  • Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.

Où allez-vous travailler ?

Vous travaillez à Bruxelles dans la Direction Customer Services, à proximité de la gare de Bruxelles-Midi et à domicile. Vous rejoignez l’équipe Customer Data composée de 8 personnes.

What’s next ?

  • Vous postulez sur notre jobsite
  • Nous analysons votre CV et votre motivation.
  • Nous vous invitons à un entretien de sélection (en ligne). Afin de préparer cet entretien, nous vous demanderons de compléter un questionnaire de personnalité et un test de raisonnement en ligne.
  • Dans un second temps, et afin de vous donner une bonne idée de la fonction, nous vous soumettrons un case study éliminatoire.
  • Si le case study est concluant, un deuxième entretien sera organisé si nécessaire.
  • Tout se déroule de manière positive ? Nous vous faisons une proposition de contrat.
  • Vous êtes prêt·e pour votre premier jour de travail !

Avez-vous encore des questions?

4184474102,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/r-d-data-science-internship-at-procter-gamble-4184474102?position=3&pageNum=2&refId=ROaTPwXFaU5qi2NADeC6GA%3D%3D&trackingId=8h4LaVgq4dQYB50ic%2FoNHw%3D%3D,R&D Data Science internship,Procter & Gamble,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Job Location
Are you passionate about the science behind products? Do you want to develop innovations for the world's biggest brands? Then a technical career at P&G could be what you are looking for!
Join us for an internship and you could soon leave your mark in fields like natural sciences, materials, automation, sustainability, analytics, simulation and modelling through your project.

We are looking for R&D Data Science intern who will help Fabric & Home Care by leveraging data-driven insights through machine learning and deep learning techniques, including convolutional neural networks, to enhance product and packaging performance and innovate solutions that meet consumer needs. In this role, you will analyze consumer data and develop predictive models all while collaborating with a dynamic team.
You will get a chance to gain industrial experience and experience what working with us is like
You will be responsible for your own project(s) from day 1 and put your technical skills to work on some of the toughest technical challenges
You will improve your collaboration and management skills through practical experience and interactive training courses
You get to experience the working environment in a leading international company and learn to work effectively with people of different nationalities and cultural backgrounds.
YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:
Masters students in Software engineering, Data science, Data engineering, instead of just Software Engineering.
Students who will be enrolled at university for the full period of the internship
Demonstrated history of academic excellence at all stages through school and university education
Passion and ability to take initiative and make things happen
Be technically curious, creative and innovative
Have a good communication and collaboration skills
If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.
A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package
Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction

Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities
Flexibility in terms of working hours
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.
ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:
Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

4189283480,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/expert-in-ai-nlp-ml-sns01378-at-sansaone-4189283480?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=ROaTPwXFaU5qi2NADeC6GA%3D%3D&trackingId=O2gplsYkF%2FNOwGc9FQEGeg%3D%3D,Expert in AI/ NLP/ ML (SNS01378),Sansaone,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Job Description
Design and implementation of AI solutions at REGIO in close collaboration with team management and AI technical lead.
Propose or support adequate machine learning models and employ NLP techniques to extract valuable insights from large datasets.
Support the development of generative AI solutions in knowledge management.
Engage with colleagues from various teams, analyze business requirements and translate them into AI solutions.
Follow AI developments within the European Commission. Attend meetings on AI and prepare briefings for the management.
DIGIT-TM II Service requirements, a minimum educational qualification
for lot XX is: Level of education corresponding to Level 7 of the European Qualification Framework which typically corresponds to a master degree of 5 years.
Minimum 5 years of professional experience in developing AI solutions, including machine learning and NLP. Proven experience with Deep Learning models and NLP techniques.
Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks.
Experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Ability to adapt to evolving technologies and methodologies in AI.
Experience in cleaning and preparing data for AI/ML models.

Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g. Docker) for the deployment of AI and machine learning applications. Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset.
Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (Git Hub) and ETL tools (e.g. dbt, Airflow).
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in application developments.
Knowledge of European Commission IT environment is an asset.
Ability to understand, speak and write in English. French will be an advantage.

Minimum 3 years experience and expertise in the command of Python and R proficiency with relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, SpaCy, NLTK, PyTorch, TensorFlow, HuggingFace, dplyr, stringr, tidymodels, torch for R, ggplot.
Minimum 1 year experience (expertise) of Semantic NLP techniques, including semantic
representation, text splitting, analysis, similarity and parsing.
Minimum 2 years of hands-on knowledge with Large Language Models (e.g. OpenAI, LLaMa and Mistal).
Outstanding communication skills and ability to deliver presentation to both business and technical audiences.
Excellent command of English. Good command of French

Job Description

Responsibility

  • Design and implementation of AI solutions at REGIO in close collaboration with team management and AI technical lead.
  • Propose or support adequate machine learning models and employ NLP techniques to extract valuable insights from large datasets.
  • Support the development of generative AI solutions in knowledge management.
  • Engage with colleagues from various teams, analyze business requirements and translate them into AI solutions.
  • Follow AI developments within the European Commission. Attend meetings on AI and prepare briefings for the management.

LEVEL OF EDUCATION

  • DIGIT-TM II Service requirements, a minimum educational qualification
  • for lot XX is: Level of education corresponding to Level 7 of the European Qualification Framework which typically corresponds to a master degree of 5 years.

Knowledge And Skills

  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience in developing AI solutions, including machine learning and NLP. Proven experience with Deep Learning models and NLP techniques.
  • Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks.
  • Experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
  • Ability to adapt to evolving technologies and methodologies in AI.
  • Experience in cleaning and preparing data for AI/ML models.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g. Docker) for the deployment of AI and machine learning applications. Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset.
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (Git Hub) and ETL tools (e.g. dbt, Airflow).
  • Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
  • Solution-oriented and accuracy to detail.
  • Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in application developments.
  • Knowledge of European Commission IT environment is an asset.
  • Ability to understand, speak and write in English. French will be an advantage.

SPECIFIC EXPERTISE

  • Minimum 3 years experience and expertise in the command of Python and R proficiency with relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, SpaCy, NLTK, PyTorch, TensorFlow, HuggingFace, dplyr, stringr, tidymodels, torch for R, ggplot.
  • Minimum 1 year experience (expertise) of Semantic NLP techniques, including semantic
  • representation, text splitting, analysis, similarity and parsing.
  • Minimum 2 years of hands-on knowledge with Large Language Models (e.g. OpenAI, LLaMa and Mistal).
  • Outstanding communication skills and ability to deliver presentation to both business and technical audiences.
  • Excellent command of English. Good command of French

Hiring Team Member

Avula Srivalli

Recruitment Coordinator

4198017934,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-v-m-x-at-national-bank-of-belgium-4198017934?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=ROaTPwXFaU5qi2NADeC6GA%3D%3D&trackingId=mzF300tdyO3wftKTHP3OTg%3D%3D,Data Scientist (V/M/X),National Bank of Belgium,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Het Data Science Center (DSC) is een dynamisch team binnen het Data & Analytics Office (GO) dat zich inzet om de producten en diensten van NBB te verbeteren met behulp van geavanceerde data science technieken. Het DSC fungeert als een center of expertise, bestaande uit 10 collega's met diepgaande kennis in verschillende data science domeinen. Het DSC stelt zijn expertise ter beschikking van heel de NBB en werkt waar mogelijk samen met andere centrale banken, waardoor zowel de gebruikte technologieën als de toepassingsdomeinen zeer gevarieerd zijn en continu evolueren.
Werken in het DSC betekent continu je data science expertise up-to-date houden, en deze inzetten om bij te dragen aan de missies van NBB.

je blijft op de hoogte van de ontwikkelingen binnen data science, in het bijzonder van de mogelijkheden en de beperkingen van kwantitatieve methodes (tijdsreeksanalyse, AI, machine learning, statistiek, wiskunde,…)
je bent bereid je voortdurend bij te scholen in deze technieken, je hebt inzicht in de technieken en legt de voor- en/of nadelen ervan uit aan je collega's

je onderzoekt en werkt mee aan concrete problemen binnen verschillenden entiteiten van de Bank, je geeft coaching aan collega's en je probeert generieke componenten voor transversaal gebruik te detecteren en te implementeren
je documenteert de oplossingen en moedigt het gebruik van de transversale componenten aan bij andere entiteiten van de Bank, bv door het geven van opleidingen in de context van de Data Academy
je zorgt ervoor dat de uitgewerkte oplossingen correct worden uitgevoerd via coaching of opleiding
je houdt hierbij rekening met de Enterprise Data Management (EDM) principes, licht die - zo nodig - toe aan de collega's en past ze toe
je zoekt samen met de collega's op een creatieve en innovatieve manier naar oplossingen voor de gestelde problemen
je zorgt voor een optimale kennisdeling rond data science binnen NBB, onder andere door inhoudelijk en organisationeel bij te dragen aan de goede werking van de NBB data science community
je netwerkt met mogelijke academische partners en andere centrale banken
je hebt een sterke achtergrond in statistiek, wiskunde en computerwetenschappen, aangevuld met de nodige relevante ervaring voor deze functie
je beschikt over een goede kennis van tijdsreeksanalyse, of bent bereid je hierin te verdiepen
je beschikt over een goede kennis van generatieve AI, of bent bereid je hierin te verdiepen
je beschikt over didactische vaardigheden om het waarom en hoe van de gebruikte (vaak complexe) technieken uit te leggen aangepast aan het kennisniveau van de doelgroep
je hebt een goede kennis van Python of R
kennis van de volgende technologieën zijn een pluspunt: de beschikbare data science componenten in Azure, Databricks, MLOps
wiskundige technieken (statistiek, algoritmes, machine learning, ...) gebruiken en uitleggen schrikt je niet af
je beschikt over de nodige kennis om oplossingen te ontwikkelen die aan de vereisten van informaticaveiligheid en vertrouwelijkheid van gegevens voldoen
je bent nieuwsgierig en gepassioneerd om innoverende oplossingen te ontwikkelen in een omgeving die voortdurend verandert.
je houdt graag je kennis up to date en schoolt jezelf graag bij in verschillende data science domeinen
je kunt zowel in een multidisciplinair team als zelfstandig werken
je bent houder van een master in de informatica, ingenieurswetenschappen, fysica, wiskunde, statistiek, handelsingenieur of je hebt een gelijkwaardige ervaring
je hebt een goede kennis van het Nederlands, Frans en het Engels (niveau B1)

Een aantrekkelijk loon en tal van bovenwettelijke voordelen (groepsverzekering, uitgebreide hospitalisatieverzekering, iPhone met abonnement...) en een goed evenwicht tussen werk- en privéleven evenals de mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk

Een echte carrière: de NBB biedt je de mogelijkheid om je voortdurend te blijven ontwikkelen. We bieden je een breed scala aan opleidingen om de vaardigheden te verwerven die je nodig hebt om je carrière verder uit te bouwen
Een unieke job, waar we onze kennis en expertise ten dienste stellen van de maatschappij
Een plek waar je initiatief kan nemen en wordt aangemoedigd om te laten zien wat je kunt
Een fijne, collegiale en dynamische werksfeer

Aandacht voor je welzijn: om ervoor te zorgen dat je je goed voelt op de werkvloer en thuis, biedt de NBB een ruim aanbod aan sportactiviteiten (fitnessruimte, groepslessen…), culturele activiteiten en inspirerende workshops.

Alleen de kandidaturen die vergezeld gaan van een motivatiebrief, een CV en een kopie van het/de diploma('s), komen in aanmerking. Buitenlandse diploma's zijn enkel geldig in combinatie met een gelijkwaardigheidsattest.
Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

Analytics Office (GO) dat zich inzet om de producten en diensten van NBB te verbeteren met behulp van geavanceerde data science technieken. 4192719968,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-generative-ai-developer-h-f-at-reply-4192719968?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=ROaTPwXFaU5qi2NADeC6GA%3D%3D&trackingId=WNz8YAKTLhmH9HriJ1NyHQ%3D%3D,Junior Generative AI Developer (H/F),Reply,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Junior Generative AI Developer
Understanding the client’s needs and the Agent's requirements gathered by your Tech Lead.
Investigate and validate the most relevant Generative AI model with your team to answer the need.
Identifying and collecting the dataset and preprocessing the data.
Developing the RAG to access relevant documentation and fetch it to your Generative AI model.
Developing the POC of the Agent, including the backend, the frontend, the API and the database.
The opportunity to acquire unique expertise in every aspect of AI Agents.
A diverse and dynamic work environment - you'll be surrounded by peers and enthusiasts who share your passion for technology.
The chance to get involved in Hackathons, Code Challenges and Lab Camps organized by Zest Reply or our Group.
A structured career progression toward more technological and managerial responsibilities.
A competitive salary with a leasing vehicle or a mobility package.
A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, or a Technology-related field.
Fluent in English as well as either French or Dutch.
Clean code practices in Python, preferably with Langchain or Langgraph.
The ability to investigate and perform research independently and an agile mindset to develop POCs.
A knowledge of Power Plaform, Neo4J and Typescript is appreciated.

Zest Reply, part of the Reply Group, is a leader in Generative AI solutions, focusing on enhancing customer engagement, compliance automation, and AI-powered software development. We collaborate with global clients across finance, telecommunications, and retail sectors, providing innovative solutions to modern business challenges. Zest Reply combines deep AI expertise with a culture of innovation and collaboration, driving cutting-edge solutions that deliver real value.

Junior Generative AI Developer


Tasks


  • Understanding the client’s needs and the Agent's requirements gathered by your Tech Lead.
  • Investigate and validate the most relevant Generative AI model with your team to answer the need.
  • Identifying and collecting the dataset and preprocessing the data.
  • Developing the RAG to access relevant documentation and fetch it to your Generative AI model.
  • Developing the POC of the Agent, including the backend, the frontend, the API and the database.


Benefits


  • The opportunity to acquire unique expertise in every aspect of AI Agents.
  • A diverse and dynamic work environment - you'll be surrounded by peers and enthusiasts who share your passion for technology.
  • The chance to get involved in Hackathons, Code Challenges and Lab Camps organized by Zest Reply or our Group.
  • A structured career progression toward more technological and managerial responsibilities.
  • A competitive salary with a leasing vehicle or a mobility package.


Qualifications


  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, or a Technology-related field.
  • Fluent in English as well as either French or Dutch.
  • Clean code practices in Python, preferably with Langchain or Langgraph.
  • The ability to investigate and perform research independently and an agile mindset to develop POCs.
  • A knowledge of Power Plaform, Neo4J and Typescript is appreciated.


About Zest Reply

Zest Reply, part of the Reply Group, is a leader in Generative AI solutions, focusing on enhancing customer engagement, compliance automation, and AI-powered software development. We collaborate with global clients across finance, telecommunications, and retail sectors, providing innovative solutions to modern business challenges. Zest Reply combines deep AI expertise with a culture of innovation and collaboration, driving cutting-edge solutions that deliver real value.

4187299575,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/solver-data-science-machine-learning-specialist-at-exsolv%C3%A6-4187299575?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=ROaTPwXFaU5qi2NADeC6GA%3D%3D&trackingId=TjHQVaZ5kW0MKaYOMiFdCA%3D%3D,Solver - Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist,Exsolvæ,"Brussels Region, Belgium","About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Data Science, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.
At Exsolvæ, our ""Solvers"" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.
We are seeking a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist with a proven ability to design, develop, and deploy transformative AI and machine learning solutions.

As a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist, you will work alongside multidisciplinary teams to unlock the full potential of data assets for clients. You will design state-of-the-art ML models, develop data-driven insights, and deploy production-grade AI solutions. Leveraging your expertise, you will help clients overcome their most pressing challenges and create sustainable value using AI and ML.
Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or a related field.
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Programming Skills: Expertise in Python and SQL, with experience in big data tools like Apache Spark or Databricks.
Machine Learning Mastery: Proficiency in TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn for designing, training, and deploying ML models.
Cloud Expertise: Hands-on experience with Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI for scalable AI deployments.
Data Visualization: Proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Python-based libraries such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Plotly.
Statistics and Mathematics: Deep understanding of linear algebra, calculus, probability, and advanced statistical techniques.
Soft Skills: Exceptional communication, critical thinking, and stakeholder management skills.
Familiarity with advanced ML techniques, such as reinforcement learning, graph ML, and large language models (LLMs).
Experience with MLOps tools like MLflow, Kubeflow, and Docker/Kubernetes.
Knowledge of causal inference frameworks (e.g., DoWhy, EconML) and time-series forecasting methods.
Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate, AWS Certified Machine Learning, or Google Professional ML Engineer.
Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to identify data challenges, define objectives, and recommend AI/ML solutions that align with business goals.
Model Development: Design and train advanced machine learning models using frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Insight Generation: Transform complex datasets into actionable insights using statistical analysis and advanced visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.
Machine Learning Solutions: Develop models for classification, regression, clustering, and NLP using modern techniques, including deep learning and reinforcement learning.
Data Engineering: Collaborate with Data Engineers to build robust data pipelines and optimize data for ML applications using platforms like Azure, AWS, or GCP.
MLOps: Deploy and maintain models in production environments using MLOps pipelines with tools like MLflow or Kubeflow.
Cloud Deployment: Implement AI workflows on cloud platforms such as Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI with scalability and performance in mind.
Stay updated on advancements in AI/ML technologies and incorporate state-of-the-art practices into client projects.
Explore innovative methodologies like transfer learning, Vision Transformers, and graph neural networks to enhance solutions.
Lead end-to-end ML projects, from problem definition to model deployment, ensuring alignment with client objectives and deadlines.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Engineers and Solution Architects, to deliver comprehensive solutions.
Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams in adopting and managing AI/ML solutions.
Provide ongoing support to ensure the scalability and performance of deployed AI systems.
Impactful Projects: Work on transformative AI/ML initiatives across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and energy.
Continuous Learning: Access to the latest tools, certifications, and training opportunities to remain at the cutting edge of AI and ML.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values knowledge sharing and collective growth.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.
If you are a driven professional with a passion for Artificial Intelligence and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful AI/ML solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Data Science, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.


At Exsolvæ, our ""Solvers"" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.


We are seeking a Data Science &
column2:
Machine Learning Specialist with a proven ability to design, develop, and deploy transformative AI and machine learning solutions.


Your Role:

As a Data Science &
column3:
Machine Learning Specialist, you will work alongside multidisciplinary teams to unlock the full potential of data assets for clients. You will design state-of-the-art ML models, develop data-driven insights, and deploy production-grade AI solutions. Leveraging your expertise, you will help clients overcome their most pressing challenges and create sustainable value using AI and ML.


What We’re Looking For:


Required Skills and Qualifications

  • Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Languages: Written &
column4:
Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
  • Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience
  • Programming Skills: Expertise in Python and SQL, with experience in big data tools like Apache Spark or Databricks.
  • Machine Learning Mastery: Proficiency in TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn for designing, training, and deploying ML models.
  • Cloud Expertise: Hands-on experience with Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI for scalable AI deployments.
  • Data Visualization: Proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Python-based libraries such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Plotly.
  • Statistics and Mathematics: Deep understanding of linear algebra, calculus, probability, and advanced statistical techniques.
  • Soft Skills: Exceptional communication, critical thinking, and stakeholder management skills.


    • Preferred Skills

    • Familiarity with advanced ML techniques, such as reinforcement learning, graph ML, and large language models (LLMs).
    • Experience with MLOps tools like MLflow, Kubeflow, and Docker/Kubernetes.
    • Knowledge of causal inference frameworks (e.g., DoWhy, EconML) and time-series forecasting methods.
    • Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate, AWS Certified Machine Learning, or Google Professional ML Engineer.


    What You’ll Do:


    Core Expertise

    • Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to identify data challenges, define objectives, and recommend AI/ML solutions that align with business goals.
    • Model Development: Design and train advanced machine learning models using frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
    • Insight Generation: Transform complex datasets into actionable insights using statistical analysis and advanced visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.


    Technical Implementation

    • Machine Learning Solutions: Develop models for classification, regression, clustering, and NLP using modern techniques, including deep learning and reinforcement learning.
    • Data Engineering: Collaborate with Data Engineers to build robust data pipelines and optimize data for ML applications using platforms like Azure, AWS, or GCP.
    • MLOps: Deploy and maintain models in production environments using MLOps pipelines with tools like MLflow or Kubeflow.
    • Cloud Deployment: Implement AI workflows on cloud platforms such as Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI with scalability and performance in mind.


    Research and Innovation

    • Stay updated on advancements in AI/ML technologies and incorporate state-of-the-art practices into client projects.
    • Explore innovative methodologies like transfer learning, Vision Transformers, and graph neural networks to enhance solutions.


    Project Management

    • Lead end-to-end ML projects, from problem definition to model deployment, ensuring alignment with client objectives and deadlines.
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Engineers and Solution Architects, to deliver comprehensive solutions.


    Training and Support

    • Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams in adopting and managing AI/ML solutions.
    • Provide ongoing support to ensure the scalability and performance of deployed AI systems.


    Why Join Us?

    • Impactful Projects: Work on transformative AI/ML initiatives across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and energy.
    • Continuous Learning: Access to the latest tools, certifications, and training opportunities to remain at the cutting edge of AI and ML.
    • Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values knowledge sharing and collective growth.
    • Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
    • Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.


    If you are a driven professional with a passion for Artificial Intelligence and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful AI/ML solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

4185021139,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-engineer-f-m-x-at-amaris-consulting-4185021139?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=ROaTPwXFaU5qi2NADeC6GA%3D%3D&trackingId=ULh%2BtMAo%2BzdvbrnKPajq8g%3D%3D,Machine Learning Engineer F/M/X,Amaris Consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
We look forward to meeting you!

Are you a skilled ML Engineer ready for your next adventure? Amaris Consulting is on the lookout for a motivated individual with a strong background in machine learning to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Brussels. This is a great opportunity for professionals with keen analytical abilities, a strong technical sense, and excellent communication skills.
Design, build, and train machine learning models to address complex business problems.
Fine-tune model performance through feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and validation techniques.
Develop pipelines to deploy machine learning models into production, ensuring reliability and scalability.
Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders to align model outcomes with strategic goals.
Stay up to date with emerging ML techniques and tools, contributing to continuous improvement initiatives.

We are seeking a candidate with a strong background in machine learning and excellent problem-solving skills. Your attention to detail and ability to simplify complex information will set you apart. You thrive in collaborative environments but can also work independently when needed.
Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).
Understanding of statistical methods, data processing, and model evaluation techniques.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
Experience with cloud-based ML platforms (AWS SageMaker, Google AI Platform, Azure ML).
Proven track record in deploying machine learning models at scale.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.
💡 We are an independent company that values:
Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.

Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System &
column2:

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

4193416236,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-sword-group-4193416236?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=ROaTPwXFaU5qi2NADeC6GA%3D%3D&trackingId=7tzBzfJVXb7%2FM7zhgYZNyw%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Sword Group,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Job Description

Voor een organisatie actief binnen het culturele en vrijetijdsdomein zoeken wij een Data Scientist die wil meewerken aan innovatieve datagedreven toepassingen met maatschappelijke meerwaarde. De opdracht maakt deel uit van een raamovereenkomst die ruimte biedt voor langdurige samenwerking op strategische en operationele dataprojecten.
De ontwikkeling, optimalisatie en het onderhoud van bestaande en nieuwe datamodellen
Het opzetten van descriptieve en predictieve analyses met impact op B2B- en B2C-toepassingen
De toepassing van machine learning en AI-technieken binnen een breed data-ecosysteem
De begeleiding van dataproducten binnen een Data Mesh architectuur
Het bijdragen aan een Europees gesubsidieerd project met focus op linked open data, gebruikscontrole en publieksontwikkeling
Het mee uittekenen van een visie en strategie rond data en AI binnen een organisatie met een sociale missie.

De data-infrastructuur is opgebouwd op Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Cloud Composer, DBT, Airflow, etc.) en maakt gebruik van Python en Jupyter Notebooks. Andere technologieën: Kubernetes, Looker Studio, ClickHouse, Jena Fuseki, GitHub Actions, Docker.
Masterdiploma of gelijkwaardige ervaring in een datagedreven domein
Ervaring met supervised/unsupervised learning, deep learning, NLP, anomaly detection, recommendation engines
Grondige kennis van Python, R of Java
Ervaring met open-source ML/AI libraries en cloud-native tools
Pluspunt: ervaring met Data Mesh architectuur en linked open data.
Teamspeler die graag samenwerkt met data engineers, analisten en productmanagers
Je kan de leefwereld van eindgebruikers vatten en houdt van maatschappelijke impact
Je bent proactief, leergierig en kan werken met deadlines.
Waarom dit project interessant is voor jou
Kans om te werken aan maatschappelijk relevante projecten binnen vrije tijd, cultuur en participatie
Deelname aan het EFRO-project “Data Spaces, Audience Data” (2025–2026), in samenwerking met overheden en andere partners
Flexibele inzet via minicompetities binnen een raamovereenkomst van minimaal 2 jaar, verlengbaar tot 4 jaar.

Job Description

Voor een organisatie actief binnen het culturele en vrijetijdsdomein zoeken wij een Data Scientist die wil meewerken aan innovatieve datagedreven toepassingen met maatschappelijke meerwaarde. De opdracht maakt deel uit van een raamovereenkomst die ruimte biedt voor langdurige samenwerking op strategische en operationele dataprojecten.

Jouw rol

Je staat mee in voor:

  • De ontwikkeling, optimalisatie en het onderhoud van bestaande en nieuwe datamodellen
column2: • Het opzetten van descriptieve en predictieve analyses met impact op B2B- en B2C-toepassingen
column3: • De toepassing van machine learning en AI-technieken binnen een breed data-ecosysteem
column4: • De begeleiding van dataproducten binnen een Data Mesh architectuur
column5: • Het bijdragen aan een Europees gesubsidieerd project met focus op linked open data, gebruikscontrole en publieksontwikkeling
column6:
• Het mee uittekenen van een visie en strategie rond data en AI binnen een organisatie met een sociale missie.


    • Technische omgeving

    De data-infrastructuur is opgebouwd op Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Cloud Composer, DBT, Airflow, etc.) en maakt gebruik van Python en Jupyter Notebooks. Andere technologieën: Kubernetes, Looker Studio, ClickHouse, Jena Fuseki, GitHub Actions, Docker.

    Wat verwachten we van jou?

    • Masterdiploma of gelijkwaardige ervaring in een datagedreven domein
column7: • Ervaring met supervised/unsupervised learning, deep learning, NLP, anomaly detection, recommendation engines
column8: • Grondige kennis van Python, R of Java
column9: • Ervaring met open-source ML/AI libraries en cloud-native tools
column10:
