4185255137,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-m-w-d-machine-learning-ki-predictive-analytics-at-calingo-insurance-ag-4185255137?position=23&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=15CTZdVegO5sjOTjuhb%2BUQ%3D%3D,Data Scientist (m/w/d) Machine Learning _ KI _ Predictive Analytics,Calingo Insurance AG,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Standort: Zürich/Basel (teilweise Homeoffice möglich)

Wir sind ein innovatives Startup im Bereich Haustierversicherungen mit Sitz in der Schweiz. Unser Ziel ist es, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen, Prozesse zu automatisieren und durch KI-gestützte Modelle einen echten Mehrwert für unsere Kunden zu schaffen. Ob bei der Risikobewertung, der optimalen Kundenansprache, Betrugserkennung oder der Optimierung von Schadens- und Kundendienstprozessen – Data Science und Machine Learning sind wichtiger Bestandteil unserer digitalen Strategie. Deshalb suchen wir eine*n Data Scientist, der/die uns hilft, innovative KI- und Analytics-Lösungen zu entwickeln und unser Unternehmen durch datengetriebene Erkenntnisse weiterzuentwickeln.
Du begeisterst dich für Data Science, KI und Machine Learning und möchtest mit modernen Technologien echte Mehrwerte schaffen.
Du hast ein tiefes analytisches Verständnis und kannst komplexe Datenmodelle entwickeln, die geschäftliche Herausforderungen lösen.
Du bist versiert in der Anwendung von Predictive Analytics und statistischen Modellen, um fundierte Vorhersagen und datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu ermöglichen.
Du arbeitest dich gerne in neue Machine-Learning-Methoden und Algorithmen ein und hältst dich über aktuelle Entwicklungen in der KI-Forschung auf dem Laufenden.
Du hast nicht nur das technische Know-how, sondern kannst auch die Ergebnisse deiner Analysen verständlich für das Business kommunizieren.
Idealerweise hast du bereits erste Erfahrungen in der Versicherungs- oder Finanzbranche gesammelt – falls nicht, bist du motiviert, dich in diese Domäne einzuarbeiten.
Dein Wohnort befindet sich in der Schweiz.

Du entwickelst KI- und Machine-Learning-Modelle, um unsere Produkte und Prozesse zu optimieren (z. B. Schadensprognosen, Risikobewertung, optimale Kundenansprache, Produktempfehlung, Betrugserkennung, Pricing-Modelle).
Du baust Predictive Analytics Pipelines und nutzt moderne Modellierungsmethoden, um datengetriebene Entscheidungen im gesamten Unternehmen zu fördern.
Du trainierst und evaluierst Deep-Learning- und Machine-Learning-Modelle, optimierst deren Performance und bringst sie in Produktion.
Du arbeitest eng mit unserem CTO und den Business-Teams zusammen, um Anforderungen zu verstehen und datengetriebene Lösungen zu entwickeln.
Du bereitest grosse Mengen an strukturierten und unstrukturierten Daten auf, führst Explorative Datenanalysen (EDA) durch und entwickelst automatisierte Feature-Engineering-Prozesse.
Du implementierst ML-Ops-Prozesse, um Modelle in einer produktiven Umgebung effizient zu verwalten, zu überwachen und zu verbessern.
Du kümmerst dich um die Optimierung von Datenqualität und Data Governance, um sicherzustellen, dass unsere Modelle auf soliden Grundlagen basieren.
Du arbeitest mit externen Data-Science- und KI-Anbietern zusammen, um Best Practices zu integrieren und unsere KI-Strategie weiterzuentwickeln.
Du bringst dein Wissen über neue Entwicklungen in Machine Learning und KI ins Team ein und treibst Innovationen voran.
Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Machine-Learning- und KI-Modellen, insbesondere in den Bereichen Supervised Learning, Unsupervised Learning, NLP oder Deep Learning.
Einen Hochschulabschluss im Bereich Informatik, Mathematik, Statistik, einer Naturwissenschaft, Ökonomieo.Ä.
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python (z. B. Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) oder R.
Erfahrung mit Predictive Analytics, statistischer Modellierung und Data Engineering.
Kenntnisse in Datenbanken (SQL, NoSQL) und verteilten Datenverarbeitungssystemen.
Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Big Data Technologien (Spark, Dask, Hadoop) oder Cloud-ML-Plattformen (AWS Sagemaker, Google Vertex AI, Azure ML).
Erfahrung mit ML-Ops und Deployment von Machine-Learning-Modellen.
Gute Kenntnisse in Datenvisualisierungstools (z. B. Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, Seaborn).
Idealerweise erste Erfahrung in der Versicherungsbranche oder mit Finanzdaten, aber nicht zwingend notwendig.
Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch.
Eine zentrale Rolle in einem wachsenden-Startup mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum und Selbstständigkeit.
Arbeiten an spannenden, realen Machine-Learning-Projekten, die einen direkten Einfluss auf das Business haben.
Zugang zu vielseitigen Datensätzen, die für Analytics und KI genutzt werden können.
Die Möglichkeit, neue Technologien und Methoden selbstständig auszuprobieren und in Produktion zu bringen.
Ein dynamisches und motiviertes Team mit einer agilen und innovativen Unternehmenskultur.
Du möchtest mithelfen sowohl unsere eigenen Softwarelösungen als auch Integrationen mit externen Partnern bzw. Anbietern zu entwickeln? Dann freuen wir uns sehr darauf, von dir zu hören.

Standort: Zürich/Basel (teilweise Homeoffice möglich)
Start: Nach Vereinbarung
Art: Vollzeit (80% - 100%)


Wir sind ein innovatives Startup im Bereich Haustierversicherungen mit Sitz in der Schweiz. Unser Ziel ist es, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen, Prozesse zu automatisieren und durch KI-gestützte Modelle einen echten Mehrwert für unsere Kunden zu schaffen. Ob bei der Risikobewertung, der optimalen Kundenansprache, Betrugserkennung oder der Optimierung von Schadens- und Kundendienstprozessen – Data Science und Machine Learning sind wichtiger Bestandteil unserer digitalen Strategie. Deshalb suchen wir eine*n Data Scientist, der/die uns hilft, innovative KI- und Analytics-Lösungen zu entwickeln und unser Unternehmen durch datengetriebene Erkenntnisse weiterzuentwickeln.


Aufgaben

Über dich



  • Du begeisterst dich für Data Science, KI und Machine Learning und möchtest mit modernen Technologien echte Mehrwerte schaffen.

  • Du hast ein tiefes analytisches Verständnis und kannst komplexe Datenmodelle entwickeln, die geschäftliche Herausforderungen lösen.

  • Du bist versiert in der Anwendung von Predictive Analytics und statistischen Modellen, um fundierte Vorhersagen und datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu ermöglichen.

  • Du arbeitest dich gerne in neue Machine-Learning-Methoden und Algorithmen ein und hältst dich über aktuelle Entwicklungen in der KI-Forschung auf dem Laufenden.

  • Du hast nicht nur das technische Know-how, sondern kannst auch die Ergebnisse deiner Analysen verständlich für das Business kommunizieren.

  • Idealerweise hast du bereits erste Erfahrungen in der Versicherungs- oder Finanzbranche gesammelt – falls nicht, bist du motiviert, dich in diese Domäne einzuarbeiten.

  • Dein Wohnort befindet sich in der Schweiz.


Deine Aufgaben



  • Du entwickelst KI- und Machine-Learning-Modelle, um unsere Produkte und Prozesse zu optimieren (z. B. Schadensprognosen, Risikobewertung, optimale Kundenansprache, Produktempfehlung, Betrugserkennung, Pricing-Modelle).

  • Du baust Predictive Analytics Pipelines und nutzt moderne Modellierungsmethoden, um datengetriebene Entscheidungen im gesamten Unternehmen zu fördern.

  • Du trainierst und evaluierst Deep-Learning- und Machine-Learning-Modelle, optimierst deren Performance und bringst sie in Produktion.

  • Du arbeitest eng mit unserem CTO und den Business-Teams zusammen, um Anforderungen zu verstehen und datengetriebene Lösungen zu entwickeln.

  • Du bereitest grosse Mengen an strukturierten und unstrukturierten Daten auf, führst Explorative Datenanalysen (EDA) durch und entwickelst automatisierte Feature-Engineering-Prozesse.

  • Du implementierst ML-Ops-Prozesse, um Modelle in einer produktiven Umgebung effizient zu verwalten, zu überwachen und zu verbessern.

  • Du kümmerst dich um die Optimierung von Datenqualität und Data Governance, um sicherzustellen, dass unsere Modelle auf soliden Grundlagen basieren.

  • Du arbeitest mit externen Data-Science- und KI-Anbietern zusammen, um Best Practices zu integrieren und unsere KI-Strategie weiterzuentwickeln.

  • Du bringst dein Wissen über neue Entwicklungen in Machine Learning und KI ins Team ein und treibst Innovationen voran.


Qualifikation

Das bringst du mit



  • Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Machine-Learning- und KI-Modellen, insbesondere in den Bereichen Supervised Learning, Unsupervised Learning, NLP oder Deep Learning.

  • Einen Hochschulabschluss im Bereich Informatik, Mathematik, Statistik, einer Naturwissenschaft, Ökonomieo.Ä.

  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python (z. B. Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) oder R.

  • Erfahrung mit Predictive Analytics, statistischer Modellierung und Data Engineering.

  • Kenntnisse in Datenbanken (SQL, NoSQL) und verteilten Datenverarbeitungssystemen.

  • Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Big Data Technologien (Spark, Dask, Hadoop) oder Cloud-ML-Plattformen (AWS Sagemaker, Google Vertex AI, Azure ML).

  • Erfahrung mit ML-Ops und Deployment von Machine-Learning-Modellen.

  • Gute Kenntnisse in Datenvisualisierungstools (z. B. Tableau, Power BI, Matplotlib, Seaborn).

  • Idealerweise erste Erfahrung in der Versicherungsbranche oder mit Finanzdaten, aber nicht zwingend notwendig.

  • Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch.


Benefits

Das bieten wir



  • Eine zentrale Rolle in einem wachsenden-Startup mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum und Selbstständigkeit.

  • Arbeiten an spannenden, realen Machine-Learning-Projekten, die einen direkten Einfluss auf das Business haben.

  • Zugang zu vielseitigen Datensätzen, die für Analytics und KI genutzt werden können.

  • Die Möglichkeit, neue Technologien und Methoden selbstständig auszuprobieren und in Produktion zu bringen.

  • Ein dynamisches und motiviertes Team mit einer agilen und innovativen Unternehmenskultur.

  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten &
column2:
Remote-Optionen.

Du möchtest mithelfen sowohl unsere eigenen Softwarelösungen als auch Integrationen mit externen Partnern bzw. Anbietern zu entwickeln? Dann freuen wir uns sehr darauf, von dir zu hören.

column1: <icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 9l5.93-4L15 6.54l-6.15 4.2a1.5 1.5 0 01-1.69 0L1 6.54 2.07 5z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

The  Microsoft Spatial AI Lab in Zurich , Switzerland, is a research and development team building the future of spatial computing. We are looking for computer vision and machine learning scientists who share our passion for developing innovative technology that can be deployed to the cloud and utilized by millions of users. We are based near ETH Zurich, the top technical school in continental Europe, enabling close collaboration in multiple areas.

You will conduct research at the intersection of computer vision, machine learning/AI, robotics and cloud computing. This research will help humans and robotic agents to understand the environment, recognize objects, and perform tasks.

This opportunity will allow you to grow your expertise in Spatial AI, learn more about deployment of algorithms to Copilot+ PC s with neural processing unit (NPU) or to cloud environments and supervise interns or be involved in joint research projects with ETH.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
Works within a team to achieve goals and objectives across services, including understanding user requirements, design, and coding.
Brings the State of the Art to Products - collaborates in an interdisciplinary team to bridge the gap between research and development.
Grows expertise in one or more subareas of research.
Develops a deep understanding of tools, technologies and methods that can be utilized to deploy product-grade, robust and efficient code in the cloud.
Grows our relationships with the research community. May contribute to publications, workshops, or the supervision of interns & PhD/MS students.
PhD in Computer Vision or AI/Machine Learning or Robotics or similar professional experience.
Demonstrated coding, debugging, and engineering skills in programming languages such as C++ or Python.
Hands-on experience with deep learning and/or computer vision methods.
Self-motivated team-player, problem solver, and keen to learn.
Ability to present complex technical concepts to a diverse audience.
Prior research in one or more of the following areas:
3D scene reasoning with open vocabularies, Vision-L anguage Models ( V LMs).
Experience with deep learning models like transformers and attention mechanisms for sequence modeling.
Video understanding, action and activity recognition.
Experience with spatio-temporal feature extraction techniques.
Robot-environment / robot-human interaction, particularly through natural language.
Publication record at top-tier conferences and journals (e.g., CVPR, ECCV, ICCV,  NeurIPS, ICLR, CoRL).

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form .
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Overview

The  Microsoft Spatial AI Lab in Zurich , Switzerland, is a research and development team building the future of spatial computing. We are looking for computer vision and machine learning scientists who share our passion for developing innovative technology that can be deployed to the cloud and utilized by millions of users. We are based near ETH Zurich, the top technical school in continental Europe, enabling close collaboration in multiple areas. 

You will conduct research at the intersection of computer vision, machine learning/AI, robotics and cloud computing. This research will help humans and robotic agents to understand the environment, recognize objects, and perform tasks. 

This opportunity will allow you to grow your expertise in Spatial AI, learn more about deployment of algorithms to Copilot+ PC s with neural processing unit (NPU) or to cloud environments and supervise interns or be involved in joint research projects with ETH. 

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond. 

Responsibilities

  • Works within a team to achieve goals and objectives across services, including understanding user requirements, design, and coding. 
  • Brings the State of the Art to Products - collaborates in an interdisciplinary team to bridge the gap between research and development. 
  • Grows expertise in one or more subareas of research. 
  • Develops a deep understanding of tools, technologies and methods that can be utilized to deploy product-grade, robust and efficient code in the cloud. 
  • Grows our relationships with the research community. May contribute to publications, workshops, or the supervision of interns &
column2:
PhD/MS students. 

Qualifications

 Required Qualification(s):

  • PhD in Computer Vision or AI/Machine Learning or Robotics or similar professional experience. 
  • Demonstrated coding, debugging, and engineering skills in programming languages such as C++ or Python. 
  • Hands-on experience with deep learning and/or computer vision methods.  
  • Self-motivated team-player, problem solver, and keen to learn. 
  • Ability to present complex technical concepts to a diverse audience. 

Preferred Qualifications: 

  • Prior research in one or more of the following areas: 
  • 3D scene reasoning with open vocabularies, Vision-L anguage Models ( V LMs). 
  • Experience with deep learning models like transformers and attention mechanisms for sequence modeling. 
  • Video understanding, action and activity recognition. 
  • Experience with spatio-temporal feature extraction techniques. 
  • Object detection and semantic segmentation. 
  • Robot-environment / robot-human interaction, particularly through natural language.
  • Publication record at top-tier conferences and journals (e.g., CVPR, ECCV, ICCV,  NeurIPS, ICLR, CoRL). 

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form .

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

4185953501,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ai-engineer-at-pixel-plus-ag-4185953501?position=25&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=1NVh9aw8neFcvAR1CxIwCg%3D%3D,AI Engineer,Pixel Plus AG,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","At Pixel Plus, we are pioneering AI-driven solutions, combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies to build scalable, cutting-edge AI platforms tailored to our clients' needs. Our AI-powered platform enables rapid development and deployment of AI applications.
We are now looking for an AI Engineer to join our team and help shape the future of AI in our projects.
🚀 Join us and drive innovation at the intersection of proprietary and open-source AI!
Design, develop, and optimize AI models by combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies, LLMs, and machine learning services.
Enhance and scale our AI Platform, integrating RAG, LLMs, and ML pipelines into real-world applications.
Develop AI agents leveraging Azure AI Foundry and open-source frameworks, enabling a ChatGPT-like experience tailored to different industries.
Work closely with engineering teams to implement best practices in AI deployment, security, and performance.
Collaborate with clients to understand business needs and transform them into scalable AI-driven solutions.
Ensure seamless integration with Azure services and open-source tools, including Cognitive Services, OpenAI models, and vector databases.
Proven experience working with Azure AI Foundry and open-source AI ecosystems.
Strong background in LLM fine-tuning, RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and AI-driven application development.
Proficiency in Python, ML frameworks, and cloud-native AI solutions.
Hands-on experience with Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI APIs, and vector search.
Experience in AI security, MLOps, and deploying scalable AI solutions.
Ability to troubleshoot and optimize AI models for performance and accuracy.
Fluent in English (German is a plus).
Exciting AI-driven projects with a strong focus on innovation.
Flexible work environment (remote or hybrid options).
Opportunity to lead AI initiatives in a fast-growing company.
Collaboration with AI & cloud experts shaping the future of AI.

Pixel Plus is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

At Pixel Plus, we are pioneering AI-driven solutions, combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies to build scalable, cutting-edge AI platforms tailored to our clients' needs. Our AI-powered platform enables rapid development and deployment of AI applications.


We are now looking for an AI Engineer to join our team and help shape the future of AI in our projects.


🚀 Join us and drive innovation at the intersection of proprietary and open-source AI!


Tasks

  • Design, develop, and optimize AI models by combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies, LLMs, and machine learning services.

  • Enhance and scale our AI Platform, integrating RAG, LLMs, and ML pipelines into real-world applications.

  • Develop AI agents leveraging Azure AI Foundry and open-source frameworks, enabling a ChatGPT-like experience tailored to different industries.

  • Work closely with engineering teams to implement best practices in AI deployment, security, and performance.

  • Collaborate with clients to understand business needs and transform them into scalable AI-driven solutions.

  • Ensure seamless integration with Azure services and open-source tools, including Cognitive Services, OpenAI models, and vector databases.


Requirements

  • Proven experience working with Azure AI Foundry and open-source AI ecosystems.

  • Strong background in LLM fine-tuning, RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and AI-driven application development.

  • Proficiency in Python, ML frameworks, and cloud-native AI solutions.

  • Hands-on experience with Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI APIs, and vector search.

  • Experience in AI security, MLOps, and deploying scalable AI solutions.

  • Ability to troubleshoot and optimize AI models for performance and accuracy.

  • Fluent in English (German is a plus).


Benefits

  • Exciting AI-driven projects with a strong focus on innovation.

  • Flexible work environment (remote or hybrid options).

  • Opportunity to lead AI initiatives in a fast-growing company.

  • Competitive salary &
column2:
benefits.
  • Collaboration with AI &

4173975683,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/2025-off-cycle-internship-%E2%80%93-gwm-data-scientist-cio-%E2%80%93-zh-at-ubs-4173975683?position=26&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=NkrLqQC9JxIuQl6ynMeVjQ%3D%3D,2025 Off-cycle Internship – GWM Data Scientist CIO – ZH,UBS,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Job Reference #

Interested in working in finance, specifically as a wealth management professional serving clients, but not sure where to start? Do you want to work for a firm with a truly global footprint that consistently ranks among the world's top financial institutions? Are you passionate about mixing technology to derive business value and excited by the prospect of helping to drive and deliver change that will positively impact the way every research analyst works in the GWM Chief Investment Office (CIO)?
We're looking for ambitious students to join our 2025 Off-cycle Internship Program within our Global Wealth Management business.
support the delivery of solutions that improve the productivity and effectiveness of analysts' community within CIO
support building a modern cloud-based data platform
generate insights and models based on transactional and behavioral data
collaborate with different teams on strategic projects with a goal of improving our client experience and driving engagement
build an understanding of our industry, culture, and strategy, while learning about how we operate to effectively meet the needs of our clients
develop professionally by establishing a network of mentors and business contacts we believe are some of the best in the business
attend educational events led by senior leaders that provide extensive exposure and insight into the business

You’ll be working in our Global Wealth Management team in Zürich. We provide advice-based solutions to deliver products and services designed to address the needs of ultra-high net worth and high-net worth individuals and families. We’ve successfully built the number one wealth management franchise in the world. You’ll work with the best talent in the industry, as we help manage, preserve and grow the wealth of our clients.

You will be part of the CIO Data Analytics team in Chief Investment Office (CIO) in our Zurich location. Our Data team is at the heart of CIO to manage and support data science efforts across different business areas. It is a global team based in Switzerland. At the heart of this project is the ability to systematically analyze and build models supporting business to make data driven decisions. Our focus is always the client!
We’re looking for a candidate who

has completed at least 4 semesters of a bachelor's degree, and graduated no longer than six months ago (bachelor's or master's degree, preferably in an analytical field e.g. Statistics, Physics, Finance, IT, Engineering)
has strong analytical and problem-solving skills, propensity to move from prototyping to concrete implementation avoiding “analysis paralysis”
has hands on experience with one or more programming languages (i.e. Python, R, NodeJs), Python is a must
has hands on experience with data science libraries like scikit, pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow
is experienced with scripting languages (bash, etc.)
has an understanding of a broad range of platforms and technologies (e.g. GitLab, Jenkins, AirFlow)
has an understanding of Agile Development's best practices
has high level of curiosity and awareness of emerging technologies, particularly in large language models like ChatGPT
has values that align with ours hard-working, trustworthy, dedicated and collaborative
is a strategic thinker with strong communication skills
is motivated to work in a business with high demands and tight deadlines

We’re looking for someone who’s curious and wants to thrive in a business that never stops moving. We welcome all majors, but it’s important to have an interest in the financial industry. We want to see what makes you unique and discover what you can bring to our team. Perhaps you’ve organized a fundraising event or taken part in team sports? Or stepped out of your comfort zone to learn about a subject you found challenging? Let us know how your achievements match the skills we’re after.

UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.

With our large and diverse team operating internationally, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Although we all come from different backgrounds and specializations, two things unite us the conviction that we’re stronger together, and the will and curiosity to constantly improve.

We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. You’ll get to learn from the best at UBS, inspirational leaders from across the business and experts in everything financial industry. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Job Reference #

314900BR

City

Zürich, Switzerland - Zürich

Your role

Interested in working in finance, specifically as a wealth management professional serving clients, but not sure where to start? Do you want to work for a firm with a truly global footprint that consistently ranks among the world's top financial institutions? Are you passionate about mixing technology to derive business value and excited by the prospect of helping to drive and deliver change that will positively impact the way every research analyst works in the GWM Chief Investment Office (CIO)?

We're looking for ambitious students to join our 2025 Off-cycle Internship Program within our Global Wealth Management business.

You’ll get to

  • support the delivery of solutions that improve the productivity and effectiveness of analysts' community within CIO
  • support building a modern cloud-based data platform
  • generate insights and models based on transactional and behavioral data
  • collaborate with different teams on strategic projects with a goal of improving our client experience and driving engagement
  • build an understanding of our industry, culture, and strategy, while learning about how we operate to effectively meet the needs of our clients
  • develop professionally by establishing a network of mentors and business contacts we believe are some of the best in the business
  • attend educational events led by senior leaders that provide extensive exposure and insight into the business


Your team

You’ll be working in our Global Wealth Management team in Zürich. We provide advice-based solutions to deliver products and services designed to address the needs of ultra-high net worth and high-net worth individuals and families. We’ve successfully built the number one wealth management franchise in the world. You’ll work with the best talent in the industry, as we help manage, preserve and grow the wealth of our clients.

You will be part of the CIO Data Analytics team in Chief Investment Office (CIO) in our Zurich location. Our Data team is at the heart of CIO to manage and support data science efforts across different business areas. It is a global team based in Switzerland. At the heart of this project is the ability to systematically analyze and build models supporting business to make data driven decisions. Our focus is always the client!

Your expertise

We’re looking for a candidate who

  • has completed at least 4 semesters of a bachelor's degree, and graduated no longer than six months ago (bachelor's or master's degree, preferably in an analytical field e.g. Statistics, Physics, Finance, IT, Engineering)
  • has strong analytical and problem-solving skills, propensity to move from prototyping to concrete implementation avoiding “analysis paralysis”
  • has hands on experience with one or more programming languages (i.e. Python, R, NodeJs), Python is a must
  • has hands on experience with data science libraries like scikit, pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow
  • is experienced with scripting languages (bash, etc.)
  • has an understanding of a broad range of platforms and technologies (e.g. GitLab, Jenkins, AirFlow)
  • has an understanding of Agile Development's best practices
  • has high level of curiosity and awareness of emerging technologies, particularly in large language models like ChatGPT
  • has values that align with ours hard-working, trustworthy, dedicated and collaborative
  • is a strategic thinker with strong communication skills
  • is motivated to work in a business with high demands and tight deadlines

We’re looking for someone who’s curious and wants to thrive in a business that never stops moving. We welcome all majors, but it’s important to have an interest in the financial industry. We want to see what makes you unique and discover what you can bring to our team. Perhaps you’ve organized a fundraising event or taken part in team sports? Or stepped out of your comfort zone to learn about a subject you found challenging? Let us know how your achievements match the skills we’re after.

Start Date May or June 2025

About Us

UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions Global Wealth Management, Personal &
column2:
Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.

With our large and diverse team operating internationally, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Although we all come from different backgrounds and specializations, two things unite us the conviction that we’re stronger together, and the will and curiosity to constantly improve.

Join us

We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. You’ll get to learn from the best at UBS, inspirational leaders from across the business and experts in everything financial industry. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?

Disclaimer / Policy Statements

UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

4194295456,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-machine-learning-engineer-at-barrington-james-4194295456?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=HGsjQTmgrNvt3R4tmfvF%2Fg%3D%3D,Senior Machine Learning Engineer,Barrington James,"Zurich, Switzerland","I am collaborating with a very exciting, incredibly well backed, start up, Biotech company with offices in Amsterdam and Zurich
They are building a cutting-edge data platform and developing a multimodal foundation model that leverages complex datasets to improve cancer diagnosis, treatment, and patient outcomes.

Oncology involves a complex interplay of data types—including medical imaging, pathology, genomics, clinical records, and patient histories. We are seeking visionary engineers to develop an agentic AI system capable of seamlessly integrating these modalities to support oncologists and enhance patient outcomes.
As part of the Agentic AI team, you will contribute to building a system that can process and reason across diverse medical data sources.
Design and implement an agentic AI system that integrates and interprets multimodal oncology data, including medical imaging, pathology slides, genomic profiles, and clinical information.
Develop intelligent agent workflows that mirror the collaborative, multidisciplinary approach of oncology care teams and tumor boards.
Build and optimize systems that understand relationships across different data modalities, extracting clinically relevant insights.
Create evaluation frameworks to rigorously assess agent performance across real-world oncology scenarios.
Research and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques, leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) and Vision-Language Models (VLMs) in agentic AI applications.
Strong programming skills in Python and PyTorch.
Deep understanding of transformer architectures and deep learning principles.
Experience training and fine-tuning foundation models.
Proficiency in prompting and developing applications with LLMs.
Solid grasp of LLM and VLM architectures and operations.
Experience with Agentic AI or familiarity with recent research in the field.
Following your application Joe Templeman, a specialist AI Recruiter will discuss the opportunity with you in detail.

He will be more than happy to answer any questions relating to the industry and the potential for your career growth. The conversation can also progress further to discussing other opportunities, which are also available right now or will be imminently becoming available.
This position has been highly popular, and it is likely that it will close prematurely. We recommend applying as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.
Please click ‘apply’ or contact Joe Templeman for any further information

I am collaborating with a very exciting, incredibly well backed, start up, Biotech company with offices in Amsterdam and Zurich


They are building a cutting-edge data platform and developing a multimodal foundation model that leverages complex datasets to improve cancer diagnosis, treatment, and patient outcomes.

Oncology involves a complex interplay of data types—including medical imaging, pathology, genomics, clinical records, and patient histories. We are seeking visionary engineers to develop an agentic AI system capable of seamlessly integrating these modalities to support oncologists and enhance patient outcomes.


As part of the Agentic AI team, you will contribute to building a system that can process and reason across diverse medical data sources.


Key Responsibilities



  • Design and implement an agentic AI system that integrates and interprets multimodal oncology data, including medical imaging, pathology slides, genomic profiles, and clinical information.


  • Develop intelligent agent workflows that mirror the collaborative, multidisciplinary approach of oncology care teams and tumor boards.


  • Build and optimize systems that understand relationships across different data modalities, extracting clinically relevant insights.


  • Create evaluation frameworks to rigorously assess agent performance across real-world oncology scenarios.


  • Research and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques, leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) and Vision-Language Models (VLMs) in agentic AI applications.



Your profile



Required Skills &
column2:
Experience:


  • Strong programming skills in Python and PyTorch.
  • Deep understanding of transformer architectures and deep learning principles.
  • Experience training and fine-tuning foundation models.
  • Proficiency in prompting and developing applications with LLMs.
  • Solid grasp of LLM and VLM architectures and operations.



Nice to Have:


  • Experience with Agentic AI or familiarity with recent research in the field.
  • Experience in Reinforcement Learning.



Benefits


  • Comprehensive salary
  • Long term incentives
  • 25+ days holiday
  • Clear development pathway


Following your application Joe Templeman, a specialist AI Recruiter will discuss the opportunity with you in detail.


He will be more than happy to answer any questions relating to the industry and the potential for your career growth. The conversation can also progress further to discussing other opportunities, which are also available right now or will be imminently becoming available.


This position has been highly popular, and it is likely that it will close prematurely. We recommend applying as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.


Please click ‘apply’ or contact Joe Templeman for any further information


Joe Templeman

Recruitment Manager – Barrington James

Email: jtempleman (at) barringtonjames.com

4189528765,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/deine-traumstelle%3F-your-dream-job%3F-at-adfinis-4189528765?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=Jrd1lFTrwWnj7QI8LPqbyQ%3D%3D,Deine Traumstelle? / Your dream job?,Adfinis,Switzerland,"(See below for the English version)
Bei unseren aktuellen Stellenausschreibungen ist nicht das Passende dabei? Lass uns wissen was deine persönliche Traumstelle wäre und bewirb dich drauf!
Wir sind immer auf der Suche nach tollen Kolleginnen und Kollegen, welche uns helfen, Open Source Lösungen zu erstellen, zu implementieren, zu bewerben und zu verkaufen.

Willst du deine Qualität und Expertise bei uns einbringen und helfen, unsere Kunden glücklich zu machen? Dann sende uns dein CV und dein Motivationsschreiben und vielleicht bist du schon bald Teil des Teams!
Can't find what you're looking for in our current job openings? Let us know what your personal dream job would be and apply for it!
We are always looking for great colleagues to help us create, implement, promote and sell open source solutions.
Do you want to bring your quality and expertise to our team and help us make our customers happy? Then send us your CV and your motivation letter and maybe you will be part of the team soon!
What tasks does your dream job include?
Welche Anforderungen erfüllst du, auf deren Suche wir sind?
What requirements do you meet that we are looking for?

(See below for the English version)


Bei unseren aktuellen Stellenausschreibungen ist nicht das Passende dabei? Lass uns wissen was deine persönliche Traumstelle wäre und bewirb dich drauf!


Wir sind immer auf der Suche nach tollen Kolleginnen und Kollegen, welche uns helfen, Open Source Lösungen zu erstellen, zu implementieren, zu bewerben und zu verkaufen.


Willst du deine Qualität und Expertise bei uns einbringen und helfen, unsere Kunden glücklich zu machen? Dann sende uns dein CV und dein Motivationsschreiben und vielleicht bist du schon bald Teil des Teams!


--


Can't find what you're looking for in our current job openings? Let us know what your personal dream job would be and apply for it!


We are always looking for great colleagues to help us create, implement, promote and sell open source solutions.


Do you want to bring your quality and expertise to our team and help us make our customers happy? Then send us your CV and your motivation letter and maybe you will be part of the team soon!

4172353389,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/member-of-technical-staff-ai-multimodal-at-microsoft-4172353389?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=Rbwg8oocCoLqiZfzmIEDXw%3D%3D,"Member of Technical Staff, AI Multimodal",Microsoft,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Help deliver one of the best foundational models in the world at Microsoft AI.

At Microsoft AI, we are on a mission to train the world’s most capable AI frontier models, pushing the boundaries of scale, performance and product deployment. The Multimodal team at Microsoft AI tackles some of the most challenging problems in deep learning at scale. As a team, we will deliver one of the best foundation models in the world, forming the foundation of many initiatives across Microsoft AI.
We are looking for outstanding individuals excited about contributing to the next generation of systems that will transform the field. In particular, we are looking for candidates who:
Have proven expertise in areas of interest, evidenced by an exceptional publication track record and/or significant technical leadership in high-impact projects.
Exhibit strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a commitment to data-driven decision-making.
Have experience and/or in-depth understandings about large-scale distributed systems.
Demonstrate an ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
Develop algorithms, design model architectures, conduct experiments, champion measurement and evaluation, innovate datasets and data pipelines
Improve training and deployment efficiency, paying careful attention to detail, persevering, and learning from everyone’s attempts whether successful or not.
Follow a rigorous data-driven approach grounded in meticulous ablation studies and scientific analysis
Innovate and iterate over ideas, prototypes, and product.
Collaborate closely with teams on infrastructure, data engineering, pre-training, post-training, and product feedback

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, data modeling or data engineering work

OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, or data engineering work
Proven track record including Research Publications on topics related to Multimodal

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Help deliver one of the best foundational models in the world at Microsoft AI.

At Microsoft AI, we are on a mission to train the world’s most capable AI frontier models, pushing the boundaries of scale, performance and product deployment. The Multimodal team at Microsoft AI tackles some of the most challenging problems in deep learning at scale. As a team, we will deliver one of the best foundation models in the world, forming the foundation of many initiatives across Microsoft AI.

About

We are looking for outstanding individuals excited about contributing to the next generation of systems that will transform the field. In particular, we are looking for candidates who:

  • Have proven expertise in areas of interest, evidenced by an exceptional publication track record and/or significant technical leadership in high-impact projects.
  • Exhibit strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a commitment to data-driven decision-making.
  • Have experience and/or in-depth understandings about large-scale distributed systems.
  • Demonstrate an ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, innovative environment.

Responsibilities

  • Develop algorithms, design model architectures, conduct experiments, champion measurement and evaluation, innovate datasets and data pipelines
  • Improve training and deployment efficiency, paying careful attention to detail, persevering, and learning from everyone’s attempts whether successful or not.
  • Follow a rigorous data-driven approach grounded in meticulous ablation studies and scientific analysis
  • Innovate and iterate over ideas, prototypes, and product.
  • Collaborate closely with teams on infrastructure, data engineering, pre-training, post-training, and product feedback
  • Advance the AI frontier responsibly
  • Embody our culture and values.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, data modeling or data engineering work
  • OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, or data engineering work
  • OR equivalent experience.
  • Proven track record including Research Publications on topics related to Multimodal

#Copilot #MicrosoftAI

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. 4183852915,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/vision-engineer-at-mikron-automation-4183852915?position=32&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=lVxM%2BvEp9t4zgluG6vePtA%3D%3D,Vision Engineer,Mikron Automation,"Boudry, Neuchâtel, Switzerland","À propos de l'entreprise

Mikron Automation est votre partenaire mondial en solutions d’automatisation avancées. Engagés à fournir les meilleurs systèmes d’assemblage et services tout au long du cycle de vie de vos produits, nous mettons à profit notre savoir-faire en ingénierie, notre expertise en processus complexes, nos plateformes évolutives et notre support durable pour assurer le succès à long terme de nos clients.

En tant que Spécialiste en vision industrielle, vous serez impliqué dans la configuration, les tests et l’optimisation des systèmes de vision pour garantir leur conformité aux exigences clients. Vous jouerez un rôle clé dans l’évaluation de la faisabilité des solutions, la configuration matérielle et logicielle des systèmes, ainsi que dans les interventions techniques en interne et chez les clients.
Effectuer les évaluations et essais de faisabilité en réponse aux demandes d’offres.
Configurer les systèmes livrés en fonction des spécifications client, tant au niveau matériel (réglage optique) que logiciel (programmation et paramétrage).
Tester les systèmes pour garantir leur bon fonctionnement conformément au cahier des charges jusqu'à leur acceptation finale (Factory Acceptance Test).
Assurer la réalisation des corrections éventuelles en collaboration avec les services concernés.
Documenter précisément l’état final des systèmes (optique, logiciels, paramètres et configuration).
Garantir l’exécution des activités dans le respect des délais et des coûts définis par le chef de projet.
Intervenir en interne et en externe pour la mise en service, l’acceptation client, les mises à jour, les dépannages et les formations (20-30% de déplacements).
Diplôme de Technicien ET ou Ingénieur HES en vision industrielle, traitement d’images, robotique ou automation (un atout).
Expérience avec les produits Cognex et/ou Keyence (un avantage).
Connaissances de base d’un langage de programmation orienté objet sous Windows (Microsoft Visual C++, Microsoft Visual Basic ou Microsoft Visual Basic.NET).
Connaissances en architecture PC/Réseau et software temps réel (un plus).
Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais (minimum B2).
L’opportunité de relever des défis variés et d’évoluer au sein d’une société internationale axée sur la satisfaction client et l’innovation technologique.
Un environnement de travail moderne, agile et multiculturel favorisant l’échange de connaissances et le développement personnel et professionnel.
Une gestion de projets centrée sur l’humain et des équipes pluridisciplinaires dynamiques.
Un poste avec des perspectives d’évolution et un accès à la formation continue pour accompagner votre développement.
Un équilibre entre vie privée et vie professionnelle dans une entreprise soucieuse du bien-être de ses collaborateurs.

À propos de l'entreprise


Mikron Automation est votre partenaire mondial en solutions d’automatisation avancées. Engagés à fournir les meilleurs systèmes d’assemblage et services tout au long du cycle de vie de vos produits, nous mettons à profit notre savoir-faire en ingénierie, notre expertise en processus complexes, nos plateformes évolutives et notre support durable pour assurer le succès à long terme de nos clients.


À propos du rôle


En tant que Spécialiste en vision industrielle, vous serez impliqué dans la configuration, les tests et l’optimisation des systèmes de vision pour garantir leur conformité aux exigences clients. Vous jouerez un rôle clé dans l’évaluation de la faisabilité des solutions, la configuration matérielle et logicielle des systèmes, ainsi que dans les interventions techniques en interne et chez les clients.


Responsabilités


Configuration et validation des systèmes

  • Effectuer les évaluations et essais de faisabilité en réponse aux demandes d’offres.
  • Configurer les systèmes livrés en fonction des spécifications client, tant au niveau matériel (réglage optique) que logiciel (programmation et paramétrage).
  • Tester les systèmes pour garantir leur bon fonctionnement conformément au cahier des charges jusqu'à leur acceptation finale (Factory Acceptance Test).
  • Assurer la réalisation des corrections éventuelles en collaboration avec les services concernés.
  • Documenter précisément l’état final des systèmes (optique, logiciels, paramètres et configuration).


Suivi et interventions

  • Garantir l’exécution des activités dans le respect des délais et des coûts définis par le chef de projet.
  • Intervenir en interne et en externe pour la mise en service, l’acceptation client, les mises à jour, les dépannages et les formations (20-30% de déplacements).


Profil du candidat


Formation et expérience

  • Diplôme de Technicien ET ou Ingénieur HES en vision industrielle, traitement d’images, robotique ou automation (un atout).
  • Expérience avec les produits Cognex et/ou Keyence (un avantage).
  • Connaissances de base d’un langage de programmation orienté objet sous Windows (Microsoft Visual C++, Microsoft Visual Basic ou Microsoft Visual Basic.NET).
  • Connaissances en architecture PC/Réseau et software temps réel (un plus).


Compétences linguistiques

  • Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais (minimum B2).
  • Connaissance de l’allemand (un avantage).


Nous vous offrons


  • L’opportunité de relever des défis variés et d’évoluer au sein d’une société internationale axée sur la satisfaction client et l’innovation technologique.
  • Un environnement de travail moderne, agile et multiculturel favorisant l’échange de connaissances et le développement personnel et professionnel.
  • Une gestion de projets centrée sur l’humain et des équipes pluridisciplinaires dynamiques.
  • Un poste avec des perspectives d’évolution et un accès à la formation continue pour accompagner votre développement.
  • Un équilibre entre vie privée et vie professionnelle dans une entreprise soucieuse du bien-être de ses collaborateurs.

4188527262,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/software-engineer-ml-data-platforms-100%25-at-pxl-vision-4188527262?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=KF7zUCYbZ7Jc2WX%2BBOKo6Q%3D%3D,"Software Engineer, ML & Data Platforms (100%)",PXL Vision,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Your mission
Trusted Role: Yes (handling sensitive data, compliance responsibilities)

You’re passionate about Applied Machine Learning and eager to apply your skills in a real-world setting. At PXL Vision, you’ll join our Core Technology Team, contributing to innovative solutions in biometrics and document scanning. You’ll collaborate with experienced engineers to build scalable, reliable systems that shape the future of identity verification and power PXL Vision’s digital identity platform.
Collaborate on the development and optimisation of infrastructure to evaluate computer vision solutions at scale
Help monitor and improve the performance of our identity verification systems in production
Build and enhance Machine Learning pipelines and support the integration of ML solutions into our products
Design and manage data pipelines for training and evaluation of ML models
Address real-world data challenges, including data taxonomy and preprocessing
Work closely with product and operations teams to align technical work with business goals
Contribute ideas and take part in building our next-generation technology
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Min. 2 years of experience in software development in Python, with a focus on Machine Learning and d
SQL skills, including writing complex queries and tuning performance.
You're motivated to improve your technical skills
Excellent problem-solving, analytical skills and excellent command of English.
Familiarity with other programming languages such as C++ or Java is a plus.
Flexible working hours & hybrid location model
You can help shape things with us and fully contribute your creativity
We are enthusiastic, international and a diverse team with a flat hierarchy
Annual training/further education budget of up to EUR 1,500
Language courses budget up to EUR 1'500

PXL Vision is the Swiss market leader and premium provider of identity verification for companies. Based on artificial intelligence, PXL Vision offers a highly flexible, modular and configurable software platform for secure and fully automated identity verification to meet complex requirements worldwide.
We aim to develop innovative, secure and reliable identity verification solutions, always with our customers in mind.
The company is headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and operates throughout Europe.

Your mission

Location: Zurich, hybrid

Trusted Role: Yes (handling sensitive data, compliance responsibilities)

You’re passionate about Applied Machine Learning and eager to apply your skills in a real-world setting. At PXL Vision, you’ll join our Core Technology Team, contributing to innovative solutions in biometrics and document scanning. You’ll collaborate with experienced engineers to build scalable, reliable systems that shape the future of identity verification and power PXL Vision’s digital identity platform.

What You Bring

  • Collaborate on the development and optimisation of infrastructure to evaluate computer vision solutions at scale
  • Help monitor and improve the performance of our identity verification systems in production
  • Build and enhance Machine Learning pipelines and support the integration of ML solutions into our products
  • Design and manage data pipelines for training and evaluation of ML models
  • Address real-world data challenges, including data taxonomy and preprocessing
  • Work closely with product and operations teams to align technical work with business goals
  • Contribute ideas and take part in building our next-generation technology

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Min. 2 years of experience in software development in Python, with a focus on Machine Learning and d
  • ata engineering.
  • SQL skills, including writing complex queries and tuning performance.
  • You're motivated to improve your technical skills
  • Excellent problem-solving, analytical skills and excellent command of English.
  • Familiarity with other programming languages such as C++ or Java is a plus.

Why us?

  • Flexible working hours &
column2:
hybrid location model
  • You can help shape things with us and fully contribute your creativity
  • We are enthusiastic, international and a diverse team with a flat hierarchy
  • Annual training/further education budget of up to EUR 1,500
  • Language courses budget up to EUR 1'500

    The company is headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and operates throughout Europe.

4165785970,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-science-internship-working-student-at-sika-4165785970?position=37&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=snNLNGBDGucLp0Ia4iXadA%3D%3D,Data Science Internship / Working Student,Sika,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.
For our Web- & eCommerce Team we are looking for an additional member, who can be a full-time intern as well as staying with us longer term as a part-time working student.
As we have multiple different projects, we are able to offer interesting topics for students who are looking to gain some experience in fields such as
column2: data science and data engineering, business analysis, and other technical fields in order to create business applications and automate processes.

column1: Functional and semantic similarity modelling for chemical products
Exposing training materials with interactive chatbots
Website parsing with AI avoiding hallucinations and information loss
Visibility to IT management if that is perceived motivating
Well defined projects in case school requires formal documentations for credit(s)
database technologies and a query language
English language is needed, German/Spanish knowledge is advantage
For insights into what our colleagues say about working at Sika, please click here.
We look forward to your direct online application.

Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

For our Web- &
column2:
eCommerce Team we are looking for an additional member, who can be a full-time intern as well as staying with us longer term as a part-time working student.

As we have multiple different projects, we are able to offer interesting topics for students who are looking to gain some experience in fields such as
column3:
data science and data engineering, business analysis, and other technical fields in order to create business applications and automate processes.

Example Assignments

  • Functional and semantic similarity modelling for chemical products
  • Recommendation/ranking algorithms for eCommerce platform
  • Exposing training materials with interactive chatbots
  • Website parsing with AI avoiding hallucinations and information loss

What We Offer

  • Dynamic and fun team
  • Multicultural environment
  • Working with senior tech leads
  • Visibility to IT management if that is perceived motivating
  • Well defined projects in case school requires formal documentations for credit(s)

Qualifications

Basic understanding of:

  • at least one programming/scripting language
  • database technologies and a query language
  • data engineering and science basics

Soft Skills

  • Willingness to learn
  • Enjoyment of problem solving
  • English language is needed, German/Spanish knowledge is advantage

Additional Information

For insights into what our colleagues say about working at Sika, please click here.

We look forward to your direct online application.

4199164061,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-machine-learning-engineer-at-reor20-4199164061?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=GkMy153MuG8lHjOIe9nxHA%3D%3D,Senior Machine Learning Engineer,REOR20,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland"," Competitive package: Salary, Options (we want you to take ownership) & awesome benefits (in fact, you will be part of defining the benefit package!)

Floods are making headlines daily, posing a growing threat worldwide. Ready to join a fast-paced company at the forefront of flood intelligence? REOR20 is looking for dynamic individuals to be key players in our mission to help communities and decision makers manage flood risks in the era of climate change.
AI is the buzzword, but we’re taking it to the next level with physics-based AI. We’re gearing up to revolutionize the industry with our cutting-edge technology.
Join us and be part of the storm that shields against flood disasters!
REOR20 is not just another flood modeling company
column2: we are a deep tech firm developing technology that, until recently, seemed like science fiction. Our innovative approach offers unparalleled flood risk understanding, pushing the boundaries of what is possible.

column1: We are pioneering the next generation of technology to deliver precise, timely flood hazard intelligence – something the industry has never seen before. Our groundbreaking approach merges high-fidelity computational engineering tools with innovative AI methodologies.
Our products are the essential tools needed to win the battle against global flooding and the climate crisis.

Our vision is clear: to become the global leader in flood hazard intelligence, setting the standard that others strive to meet. We are assembling our core engineering team to build and launch the first commercial-scale version of our product. Joining this team means engaging in a variety of tasks and taking on diverse responsibilities.
REOR20 champions an open, flexible, and inclusive culture. We pursue excellence, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and embrace the diverse challenges across all aspects of our company.

We offer excitement, fun, and a rewarding mission! Join us, and you’ll always be at the forefront, contributing to a future where our solutions save lives, protect properties, and create a safer, more resilient world.

Join our innovative and dynamic startup as a Machine Learning Engineer and play a pivotal role in the development of our groundbreaking flood prediction technology. You will lead and own the end-to-end design, implementation, and deployment of advanced deep learning models. Leveraging your expertise in Machine Learning and Software Engineering, you will create and extend robust and scalable pipelines that drive our data processing, model training, and deployment infrastructure. Your work will ensure the optimal performance and reliability of our cutting-edge flood prediction systems, helping to mitigate the impact of floods worldwide.
Design, develop, and implement state-of-the-art solutions along the entire model development life cycle, focusing on optimizing performance and scalability.
Build and maintain the infrastructure for training and testing machine learning models, create and manage large datasets, and ensure robust and scalable data pipelines.
Investigate and propose new tools and infrastructure to accelerate the development of our state-of-the-art flood models and to optimize all key steps of the model pipeline
Collaborate with software engineers to deliver deployment ready models.
You should apply if you have
Excellent coding skills with proficiency in Python and hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks (preferably PyTorch).
Affinity for designing and optimize machine learning pipelines for scalability and performance
Experience in large-scale data processing and cloud computing (e.g., AWS) is preferred
Knowledge of MLOps best practices or large-scale model deployment is a plus

column2: Competitive package: Salary, Options (we want you to take ownership) &
column3: awesome benefits (in fact, you will be part of defining the benefit package!)

4190919074,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-ai-scientist-at-vf-corporation-4190919074?position=41&pageNum=0&refId=7seE469UY6C2FEjLJbbQvg%3D%3D&trackingId=fyJEnL4X6MFhTSqEteryFw%3D%3D,Senior AI Scientist,VF Corporation,"Stabio, Ticino, Switzerland","VF Corporation is looking for an exceptional Senior AI Scientist to join our Data & Analytics team based in Stabio, Switzerland.

The ideal candidate will have extensive years of experience in data science, with a strong focus on generative AI, and advanced forecasting. This role will involve developing and implementing advanced AI models to drive cutting edge innovation across the value chain, from Design to Planning. Working side-by-side with the business, the resource will drive AI transformation in the business and regional commercial community.
Develop and deploy generative AI models to support merchandising lifecycle
Develop next gen forecasting models to fuel our regional trading activities
Optimize and fine-tune AI models for performance, scalability, and accuracy.
Present findings and recommendations to senior business stakeholders in the regions. Embed capability and create AI trust in the business community
Play as a organizational change agents, to support AI and Gen.AI transformation in the organization.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, and apply them to enhance our fashion products and services
Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or Engineering
Extensive years of experience in data science, with a focus on newest generative AI technology
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Experience with AI frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
Strong understanding of deep learning, neural networks and GAN (general adversarial network)
Proven track record of developing and deploying AI models in a production environment.
Digital native, with Passion for fashion and a keen eye for Gen.AI trends.
Retail/Fashion background will be considered a plus

VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It’s the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com

We’re in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we’re the total package.
A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks
This post is not eligible for relocation support.

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.
As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.
If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!
VF Corporation is looking for an exceptional Senior AI Scientist to join our Data &
column2:
Analytics team based in Stabio, Switzerland.


Let’s talk about the role!

The ideal candidate will have extensive years of experience in data science, with a strong focus on generative AI, and advanced forecasting. This role will involve developing and implementing advanced AI models to drive cutting edge innovation across the value chain, from Design to Planning. Working side-by-side with the business, the resource will drive AI transformation in the business and regional commercial community.


Job Details

  • Develop and deploy generative AI models to support merchandising lifecycle
  • Develop next gen forecasting models to fuel our regional trading activities
  • Optimize and fine-tune AI models for performance, scalability, and accuracy.
  • Present findings and recommendations to senior business stakeholders in the regions. Embed capability and create AI trust in the business community
  • Play as a organizational change agents, to support AI and Gen.AI transformation in the organization.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, and apply them to enhance our fashion products and services


Skills For Success

  • Master's or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or Engineering
  • Extensive years of experience in data science, with a focus on newest generative AI technology
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
  • Experience with AI frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
  • Strong understanding of deep learning, neural networks and GAN (general adversarial network)
  • Proven track record of developing and deploying AI models in a production environment.
  • Digital native, with Passion for fashion and a keen eye for Gen.AI trends.
  • Retail/Fashion background will be considered a plus


About VF

VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It’s the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com


What’s In It For You

We’re in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we’re the total package.


  • A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
  • An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
  • Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
  • On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
  • A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
  • Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks


This post is not eligible for relocation support.


Free to Be, Inclusion &
column3:
Diversity

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.


As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.


If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!
